Pool-root
Nervous erethism; restlessness and morbid watchfulness. Hysteria and chorea. Low fevers, with extreme restlessness.
Aphthous disease. *Sore nipples*. Sore mouth in infants. Vomiting of bile, pain in stomach, headache, and fever.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Lapsana communis*-Nipple-wort-useful in sore nipples and piles. *Hyosc; Passiflor; Hydr mur*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tincture, locally, in sore mouth and sore nipples. Internally, tincture to third attenuation.

euphorbium-officinarum.name: Euphorbium Officinarum
euphorbium-officinarum.essence: Spurge-The resinous Juice of Euphorbia Resinifera (EUPHORBIUM)

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Spurge-The resinous Juice of Euphorbia Resinifera (EUPHORBIUM)
An irritant to the skin and mucous membranes. Burning pain in bones. Pains in limbs and paralytic weakness in the joints. Important respiratory and skin symptoms. Terrible burning pains. *Pains of cancer*. Everything appears larger than it really is.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Acute mania. Violent, pressive headache.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Erysipelas; yellow blisters. Burning in cheek; worse, left. Eyes inflamed and agglutinated in morning; Red swelling of cheeks. Nasal pruritus with mucous secretions from naso-pharynx.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Great hunger. Sialorrhea (profuse salty saliva). Waterbrash. Thirst for cold drinks.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Sunken; spasmodic, flatulent colic. Stools fermented, profuse, clayey. Feels hollow.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Breathing oppressed, as if chest were not wide enough. Spasmodic, dry cough, day and night, with asthma. Violent, fluent coryza, with burning and cough. Constant cough, with stitches from pit of stomach to sides of chest. Croup, dry, hollow, cough. Warm feeling in chest, as if hot food had been swallowed.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Paralytic pains. Pain in hip-joint and coccyx.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Erysipelatous inflammation, especially of the cheek. Biting and stinging, red, swollen. *Vesicular erysipelas*. Carbuncle; old, torpid, indolent ulcers with biting, lancinating pain. Old torpid ulcer, pustules; *gangrene* (*Echinac; Secale*). Ulcerating carcinoma and epithelioma of the skin.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Compare: *Euphorbia amygdaloides*-Wood Spurge (in pain in antrum, illusion of smell, *odor of mice*. Sense of taste blunted. Diarrhoea; stools difficult, with painful anal spasm).
*Euphorbia corollata*-Large Flowering Spurge--(a diaphoretic expectorant and cathartic of the old school in gastro-enteric disturbance, with deathly nausea. Vomiting of food, water, and mucus and copious evacuations. Attacks recur after short intermissions. Feeling of clawing in stomach; cold sweat) (*Verat alb*).
*Euphorbia marginata*-Snow on the mountain--(Honey from the flowers is poisonous, detected by the hot, acrid taste. The milky juice produces skin symptoms like *Rhus*).
*Euphorbia pilulifera*-Pillbearing Spurge--(Humid asthma, cardiac dyspnoea, hay-fever, and bronchitis. Urethritis, with intense pain on urinating, and much urging. Acrid leucorrhoea; worse least movement. Haemorrhages from sunstroke and traumatism).
Compare, also: *Psoralea*-A Columbian plant--(Pain of cancer, ulcers. Leucorrhoea fetid. Pruritus. Uterine tumors). *Croton; Jatropha; Colchic*.
Antidotes: *Camph; Opium*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third to sixth potency.

euphrasia-officinalis.name: Euphrasia Officinalis
euphrasia-officinalis.essence: Manifests itself in inflaming the conjunctival membrane especially, producing profuse lachrymation. Patient is better in open air. Catarrhal affections of mucous membranes especially of eyes and nose. Profuse *acrid* lachrymation and bland coryza; worse, evening. Hawking up of offensive mucus.

complementary: Cepa; Ars; Gels; Kali hyd; Sabadilla

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Frequent yawning when walking in open air. Profuse, fluent coryza in morning, with much cough and expectoration. Influenza. Gags when clearing the throat in morning. Whooping-cough only in day-time, with profuse lachrymation.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: First stage of measles; eye symptoms marked. Consequence of external injuries.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Yawning when walking in open air. Sleepy during day.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Chilly and cold. Sweat mostly on chest, at night during sleep.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, in evening, indoors, warmth; south winds; from light. *Better*, from coffee, in dark.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Eyebright (EYEBRIGHT)
Manifests itself in inflaming the conjunctival membrane especially, producing profuse lachrymation. Patient is better in open air. Catarrhal affections of mucous membranes especially of eyes and nose. Profuse *acrid* lachrymation and bland coryza; worse, evening. Hawking up of offensive mucus.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Bursting headache with dazzling of eyes. *Catarrhal headache*, with profuse discharge from eyes and nose.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Profuse, fluent coryza*, with violent cough and abundant expectoration.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Catarrhal* conjunctivitis; discharge of acrid matter. *The eyes water all the time*. Acrid lachrymation; bland coryza (Opposite: *Cepa*). Discharge thick and excoriating (*Mercur* thin and acrid). Burning and swelling of the lids. Frequent inclination to blink. Free discharge of acrid matter. Sticky mucus on cornea; must wink to remove it. Pressure in eyes. Little blisters on cornea. Opacities. Rheumatic iritis. Ptosis (*Gels; Caust*).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Redness and heat of cheeks. Stiffness of upper lip.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Vomiting from hawking mucus. Nausea and bitterness after smoking.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Dysentery. Prolapse ani. Pressure down in anus when sitting. *Constipation*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Menses *painful; flow lasts only an hour or day*; late, scanty, short. *Amenorrhoea, with ophthalmia*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Spasmodic retraction of genitals, with pressure above pubic bone. Condyloma and sycotic excrescences. *Prostatitis*. Nocturnal irritability of bladder; dribbling urine.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Antidotes: *Camph; Puls*. Compare: *Hydrophyllum*-Burr -flower--(catarrhal inflammation of eyes; hot lachrymation with itching, swollen lids, dull headache; also for effects of Poison-Oak); *Cepa; Ars; Gels; Kali hyd; Sabadilla*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third to sixth potency.

eupionum.name: Eupionum
eupionum.essence: Marked female symptoms, and backache. A remedy for *uterine displacements*. Pain in back, followed by a bland leucorrhoea. Menses too early and copious; flow thin. *Intense sweat from slightest exertion*. Disgusting dreams. Sensation as if whole body were made of jelly.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Wood-tar distillation (EUPION)
Marked female symptoms, and backache. A remedy for *uterine displacements*. Pain in back, followed by a bland leucorrhoea. Menses too early and copious; flow thin. *Intense sweat from slightest exertion*. Disgusting dreams. Sensation as if whole body were made of jelly.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Vertigo; everything turns round on sitting up in bed. Heat at vertex; stitches from vertex down limbs into abdomen and genitals. Sore painful spots on head. Painful pulsation in forehead.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Burning in right ovary. Gushing leucorrhoea*. Chronic tubal disease. Uterine flexions. Menses too early and copious. During menses, irritable and disinclined to talk; burning and stitches in chest and heart. After menses, yellow *leucorrhoea, with severe backache*. When pain in back ceases, the discharge gushes out. Sore pain between labia during urination. Pruritus pudendi; labia swollen.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Cramps in the calves*; worse at night.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Sacrum pains, as if broken. Severe backache; must lean against something for support. Pains extended into pelvis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Kreosot; Graph; Lach*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third potency.

eupatorium-perfoliatum.name: Eupatorium Perfoliatum
eupatorium-perfoliatum.essence: Known as "Bone-set", from the prompt manner in which it relieves pain in limbs and muscles that accompanies some forms of febrile disease, like malaria and influenza. Eupatorium acts principally upon the gastro-hepatic organs and bronchial mucous membrane. It is a boon in miasmatic districts, along rivers, marshes, etc, and in all conditions where there is a great deal of bone-pain. Cachexia from old chronic, bilious intermittents. Worn-out constitutions from inebriety. Sluggishness of all organ...

amel: by conversation, by getting on hands and knees

complementary: Bryon; Sepia; Natr mur; Chelidon. Nyctanthes arbor-tristis

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Thoroughwort
Known as "Bone-set", from the prompt manner in which it relieves pain in limbs and muscles that accompanies some forms of febrile disease, like malaria and influenza. Eupatorium acts principally upon the gastro-hepatic organs and bronchial mucous membrane. It is a boon in miasmatic districts, along rivers, marshes, etc, and in all conditions where there is a great deal of bone-pain. Cachexia from old chronic, bilious intermittents. Worn-out constitutions from inebriety. Sluggishness of all organs and functions. Bone-pains, general and severe. Soreness. Marked periodicity (*Ars; China; Cedron*).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Throbbing pain. Pressure as if a cap of lead pressed over the whole skull. Vertigo; sensation of falling to *left*. Vomiting of bile. Top and back of head with pain and *soreness of eyeballs*. Periodical headache, every third and seventh day. *Occipital pain after lying down, with sense of weight*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Cracks in corners of mouth, yellow coated tongue, thirst.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tongue yellow. Taste bitter. Hepatic region sore. Great thirst. Vomiting and purging of bile, of green liquid several quarts at a time. Vomiting preceded by thirst. *Hiccough* (*Sulph ac; Hydrocy ac*). Avoids tight clothing.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Frequent, green watery. Cramps. Constipated, with sore liver.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Coryza, with sneezing. *Hoarseness and cough, with soreness in chest*; must support it. *Influenza*, with great soreness of muscles and bones. *Chronic* loose cough, chest sore; *worse at night*. Cough relieved by getting on hands and knees.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Perspiration relieves all symptoms except headache. Chill between 7 and 9 am, *preceded by thirst with great soreness and aching of bones*. Nausea, vomiting of bile at close of chill or hot stage; throbbing headache. Knows chill is coming on because he cannot drink enough.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Aching pain in back. Aching in bones of extremities with soreness of flesh. Aching in arms and wrists*. Swelling of left great toe. Gouty soreness and inflamed nodosities of joints, associated with headache. Dropsical swelling.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, periodically. *Better*, by conversation, by getting on hands and knees.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Bryon; Sepia; Natr mur; Chelidon. Nyctanthes arbor-tristis* (bilious fever; insatiable thirst; bitter vomiting at close of chill; also constipation of children).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tincture, to third attenuation.

eupatorium-purpureum.name: Eupatorium Purpureum
eupatorium-purpureum.essence: Albuminuria, diabetes, strangury, *irritable bladder*, enlarged prostate are a special field for this remedy. Excellent in renal dropsy. Chills and pains run upwards. Impotency and sterility. Homesickness.

complementary: Senecio; Cannab sat; Helon; Phos ac; Triticum; Epigea

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Queen of the Meadow
Albuminuria, diabetes, strangury, *irritable bladder*, enlarged prostate are a special field for this remedy. Excellent in renal dropsy. Chills and pains run upwards. Impotency and sterility. Homesickness.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Left-sided headache with vertigo*. Pain from left shoulder to occiput. Sick headache beginning in morning, worse afternoon and evening, worse in cold air.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Deep, dull pain in kidneys. Burning in bladder and urethra on urinating. Insufficient flow; milky. Strangury. Haematuria. Constant desire; bladder feels dull. Dysuria. *Vesical irritability in women. Diabetes insipidus*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Weight and heaviness in loins and back.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain around left ovary. Threatened abortion. External genitals feel as though wet.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: No thirst during chill, but much frontal ache. *Chill commences in back*. Violent shaking, with comparatively little coldness. Bone-pains.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Senecio; Cannab sat; Helon; Phos ac; Triticum; Epigea*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: First potency.

fabiana-imbricata.name: Fabiana Imbricata
fabiana-imbricata.essence: A South American shrub cultivated in Southern California. It is a terebrinthine diuretic. It has also tonic and chologogue properties, used in the treatment of nasal catarrh, jaundice, dyspepsia and to increase the secretion of bile (Albert Schneider). Useful in the uric acid diathesis, cystitis, gonorrhoea, *prostatitis*, dysuria, vesical catarrh with suppurative prostatic conditions; post-gonorrhoeal urinary conditions; cholethiasis and liver affections. Vesical tenesmus and burning after urin...
fabiana-imbricata.dosing: Ten to twenty drops of the tincture.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Pichi
A South American shrub cultivated in Southern California. It is a terebrinthine diuretic. It has also tonic and chologogue properties, used in the treatment of nasal catarrh, jaundice, dyspepsia and to increase the secretion of bile (Albert Schneider). Useful in the uric acid diathesis, cystitis, gonorrhoea, *prostatitis*, dysuria, vesical catarrh with suppurative prostatic conditions; post-gonorrhoeal urinary conditions; cholethiasis and liver affections. Vesical tenesmus and burning after urination. Excoriating urine and calculi.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Ten to twenty drops of the tincture.

fagopyrum-esculentum.name: Fagopyrum Esculentum
fagopyrum-esculentum.essence: Its action on the skin, producing pruritus, is very marked. Visible pulsation of arteries. Fluent coryza. Offensive excretions. Itching erythema. *Pruritus senilis*. Post-nasal catarrh; dry crusts, granular appearance of posterior nares with itching.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Buckwheat (FAGOPYRUM)
Its action on the skin, producing pruritus, is very marked. Visible pulsation of arteries. Fluent coryza. Offensive excretions. Itching erythema. *Pruritus senilis*. Post-nasal catarrh; dry crusts, granular appearance of posterior nares with itching.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Inability to study or remember. Depressed and irritable. Itching of eyes and ears. Pains deep in head, *with upward pressure*. Itching in and around eyes and ears. Head hot, better bending backward, with tired neck. Occipital headache. Bursting pains. Cerebral hyperaemia.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Sore, red, inflamed. Fluent coryza, with sneezing, followed by dryness and crust formation.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Itching* and smarting, swelling, heat and soreness.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Soreness and feeling of excoriation, deep down pharynx. Uvula elongated, tonsils swollen.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Eructations of *scalding, hot*, acid, watery substance; better, coffee. Bad taste in the morning. Persistent, morning nausea. Drooling.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain around heart, better lying on back, extending to left shoulder and arm. *Throbbing in all arteries* after retiring. Palpitation with oppression. Pulse irregular, intermittent, rapid. Light feeling in chest.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Pruritus vulvae, with yellow leucorrhoea*, worse, rest. Burning in right ovary.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Stiffness and bruised sensation in the muscles of the neck, with sensation as if nape of neck could not support head. Pain in shoulder, with pain along fingers. *Vehement itching in arms and legs*; worse towards evening. Feet numb and pricking. Streaking pains in arms and legs.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Itching*; better by bathing in cold water; worse scratching, touch and retiring. Sore red blotches. Blind boils. Itching of knees and elbows and hairy portions. *Itching of hands, deep in*. Vesicular, pustular, phlegmonous dermatitis. Skin hot, swollen.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Better*, cold water, coffee; *worse*, in afternoon; from sunlight, scratching.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Dolichos; Bovista; Urtica*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third potency and 12x.

fel-tauri.name: Fel Tauri
fel-tauri.essence: Increases the duodenal secretion, emulsifies fats and increases the peristaltic action of the intestines. Liquefies bile and acts as a purgative and chologogue. Disordered digestion, diarrhoea, and pain in nape of neck are among its chief symptoms. Obstruction of gall ducts. Biliary calculi. Jaundice.
fel-tauri.dosing: Lower triturations. Purified oxgall 1 to 10 gr.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Ox-gall
Increases the duodenal secretion, emulsifies fats and increases the peristaltic action of the intestines. Liquefies bile and acts as a purgative and chologogue. Disordered digestion, diarrhoea, and pain in nape of neck are among its chief symptoms. Obstruction of gall ducts. Biliary calculi. Jaundice.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Eructations, gurgling in stomach and epigastric region. Violent peristaltic movements. *Tendency to sleep after eating*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Merc dulc; Cholesterin*. In Biliary Lithiasis, *China. Calculobili*-Triturate Gall stones-10-12x (Gall stones).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Lower triturations. Purified oxgall 1 to 10 gr.

ferrum-metallicum.name: Ferrum Metallicum
ferrum-metallicum.essence: Best adapted to young weakly persons, anaemic and chlorotic, with pseudo-plethora, who flush easily; cold extremities; *oversensitiveness*; worse after any active effort. *Weakness* from mere speaking or walking though looking strong. *Pallor* of skin, mucous membranes, face, alternating with flushes. Orgasms of blood to face, chest, head, lungs, etc. Irregular distribution of blood. Pseudo-plethora. Muscles flabby and relaxed.

agg: while sitting still. After cold washing and overheating. *Midnight aggravation
amel: walking slowly about. Better after rising

ferrum-metallicum.dosing: States of debility where the blood is poor in hematin require material doses; plethoric, haemorrhagic conditions call for small doses, from the second to the sixth potency.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Involuntary; worse daytime. Tickling in urethra extending to bladder.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Undigested, at night, while eating or drinking, painless. Ineffectual urging; stool hard, followed by backache or cramping pain in rectum; prolapsus recti; itching of anus, especially young children.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Iron
Best adapted to young weakly persons, anaemic and chlorotic, with pseudo-plethora, who flush easily; cold extremities; *oversensitiveness*; worse after any active effort. *Weakness* from mere speaking or walking though looking strong. *Pallor* of skin, mucous membranes, face, alternating with flushes. Orgasms of blood to face, chest, head, lungs, etc. Irregular distribution of blood. Pseudo-plethora. Muscles flabby and relaxed.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Irritability. *Slight noises unbearable*. Excited from slightest opposition. Sanguine temperament.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Vertigo on seeing flowing water. Stinging headache. Ringing in ears before menses. *Hammering*, pulsating, congestive headache; pain extends to teeth, with cold extremities. Pain in *back of head*, with roaring in neck. Scalp painful. Must take down the hair.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Watery, dull red; photophobia; letters run together.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Fiery-red and *flushed from least pain, emotion, or exertion. Red parts become white*, bloodless and puffy.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Mucous membrane relaxed, boggy, anaemic, pale.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Pain in teeth; relieved by icy-cold water*. Earthy, pasty taste, like rotten eggs.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Voracious* appetite, or absolute loss of appetite. Loathing of sour things. Attempts to eat bring on diarrhoea. *Spits up food by the mouthful* (*Phos*). Eructations of food after eating, without nausea. Nausea and vomiting after eating. *Vomiting immediately after eating. Vomiting after midnight. Intolerance of eggs*. Distention and pressure in the stomach after eating. Heat and burning in stomach. Soreness of abdominal walls. Flatulent dyspepsia.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Menses remit a day or two, and then return. Discharge of long pieces from uterus. Women who are weak, delicate, chlorotic, yet have a fiery-red face. Menses too early, too profuse, last too long; pale, watery. Sensitive vagina. Tendency to abortion. Prolapse of vagina.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Chest *oppressed*; breathing difficult. Surging of blood to chest. Hoarseness. Cough dry, spasmodic. Haemoptysis (*Millefol*). With the cough pain in occiput.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Palpitation; worse, movement. Sense of oppression. Anaemic murmur. *Pulse full, but soft and yielding; also, small and weak. Heart suddenly bleeds into the blood vessels*, and as suddenly draws a reflux, leaving pallor of surface.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Rheumatism of the shoulder. Dropsy after loss of vital fluids. Lumbago; better, slow walking. Pain in hip-joint, tibia, soles, and heel.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pale; flushes readily; pits on pressure.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: General coldness of extremities; head and face hot. *Chill at* 4 am. Heat in palms and soles. Profuse, debilitating sweat.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Better*, walking slowly about. Better after rising. *Worse*, while sweating; while sitting still. After cold washing and overheating. *Midnight aggravation*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Antidotes: *Ars; Hep*.
Complementary.: *Chin; Alum; Hamamel*.
Compare: *Rumex* (similar in respiratory and digestive sphere and contains organic iron).
*Ferrum aceticum* (alkaline urine in acute diseases. Pain in right deltoid. Epistaxis; especially adapted to thin, pale, weak children who grow rapidly and are easily exhausted; *varices of the feet*; copious expectoration of greenish pus; asthma; worse, sitting still and lying; phthisis, constant cough, vomiting of food after eating, haemoptysis).
*Ferrum arsenicum* (enlarged liver and spleen, with fever; undigested stool; albuminuria). Simple and pernicious anaemia and chlorosis. Skin dry. Eczema, psoriasis, impetigo (Use 3x trituration).
*Ferrum bromatum* (sticky, excoriating leucorrhoea; uterus heavy and prolapsed, scalp feels numb).
*Ferrum cyanatum* (neuroses with irritable weakness and hypersensitiveness, especially of a periodical character; *epilepsy*; cardialgia, with nausea, flatulence, constipation, alternating with diarrhoea; chorea).
*Ferrum magneticum* (small warts on hands)
*Ferrum muriaticum* (Arrested menstruation; tendency to seminal emissions or copious urination at puberty; very dark, watery stools; diphtheria; phlegmonous erysipelas; pyelitis; haemoptysis of dark, clotty blood; dyspareunia; pain in *right shoulder*, right elbow, and marked tendency to cramps and round red spots on cheeks; bright crystals in urine. Anaemia, 3x, after meals. Tincture 1-5 drops 3 times daily for chronic interstitial nephritis).
*Ferrum sulphuricum* (Watery and painless stools; menorrhagia pressing, throbbing between periods with rush of blood to head. Basedow's disease. Erethism. Pain in gall-bladder; toothache; acidity; eructation of food in mouthfuls); *Ferrum pernitricum* (cough, with florid complexion); *Ferrum tartaricum* (cardialgia; heat at cardiac orifice of stomach).
*Ferrum protoxalatum* (Anaemia). Use 1x trit. Compare also; *Graph; Mangan; Cupr*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: States of debility where the blood is poor in hematin require material doses; plethoric, haemorrhagic conditions call for small doses, from the second to the sixth potency.

ferrum-iodatum.name: Ferrum Iodatum
ferrum-iodatum.essence: Scrofulous affections, glandular enlargements, and tumors call for this remedy. Crops of boils. Acute nephritis following eruptive diseases. Uterine displacements. Body emaciated Anaemia Exophthalmic goitre following suppression of menses. Debility following drain upon vital forces. Impetigo of the cheek.
ferrum-iodatum.dosing: Third trituration. Does not keep long.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Iodide of Iron
Scrofulous affections, glandular enlargements, and tumors call for this remedy. Crops of boils. Acute nephritis following eruptive diseases. Uterine displacements. Body emaciated Anaemia Exophthalmic goitre following suppression of menses. Debility following drain upon vital forces. Impetigo of the cheek.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Food seems to push up into throat, as if it had not been swallowed.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Fullness, even after a little food; stuffed feeling, as if she could not lean forward.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Sore, as if of a splinter, shooting in different directions. Hoarse.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Coryza; discharge of mucus from nose, trachea, and larynx. Pressure beneath sternum. Scrofulous swelling of nose. Chest feels oppressed. Haemoptysis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Urine dark. Sweet smelling. *Crawling sensation in urethra and rectum*. Sensation as if urine were stopped at fossa navicularis. Difficulty in retaining urine. Incontinence in anaemic children.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: On sitting, *feeling as if something pressed upward in vagina*. Much bearing down. Retroversion and prolapse of uterus. Leucorrhoea like boiled starch. Menses suppressed or scanty. Itching and soreness of vulva and vagina.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third trituration. Does not keep long.

ferrum-magneticum.name: Ferrum Magneticum
ferrum-magneticum.essence: Marked symptoms in intestinal tract. Pain in nape of neck. Paralytic weakness. Small warts on hands.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Loadstone
Marked symptoms in intestinal tract. Pain in nape of neck. Paralytic weakness. Small warts on hands.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: During a meal, flatulence; afterwards lassitude taciturn and hot, pain in epigastrium, especially on breathing.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Movements and grumbling in abdomen. Loose evacuations with much flatulency, especially left side with pullings in legs. Abundant and frequent emission of fetid flatus.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third potency.

ferrum-picricum.name: Ferrum Picricum
ferrum-picricum.essence: Is considered a great remedy to complete the action of other medicines. The symptom that specially calls for it is failure of the function of an organ under exertion; e g, the voice fails after public speaking. Acts best in dark-haired patients, plethoric, with sensitive livers. Warts and epithelial growths; corns with yellowish discoloration. *Senile hypertrophy of the prostate. Epistaxis*. Chronic deafness and tinnitus due to gout. Meatus dry. Pseudo-leucaemia.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Picrate of Iron
Is considered a great remedy to complete the action of other medicines. The symptom that specially calls for it is failure of the function of an organ under exertion; e g, the voice fails after public speaking. Acts best in dark-haired patients, plethoric, with sensitive livers. Warts and epithelial growths; corns with yellowish discoloration. *Senile hypertrophy of the prostate. Epistaxis*. Chronic deafness and tinnitus due to gout. Meatus dry. Pseudo-leucaemia.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Deafness before menses. Crackling in ears and low-pitched voice. Vascular deafness. Dental neuralgia, radiating towards ears and eyes. Humming in ears as from telegraph wires. Tinnitus.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Indigestion, furred tongue, headache after meals, especially in bilious, dark-haired persons.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain along entire urethra. *Frequent micturition at night, with full feeling and pressure in rectum. Smarting at neck of bladder and penis* (*Barosma*). Retention of urine.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain in right side of neck and down right arm. Locomotor ataxia, ocular stage. Hands covered with warts.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Second and third trituration.

ficus-religiosa.name: Ficus Religiosa
ficus-religiosa.essence: This East Indian drug causes and cures haemorrhages of many kinds. Haematemesis, menorrhagia, haemoptysis, etc. Bloody urine.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Ashwathya
This East Indian drug causes and cures haemorrhages of many kinds. Haematemesis, menorrhagia, haemoptysis, etc. Bloody urine.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Melancholic-quiet; burning at vertex; vertigo and slight headache.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Nausea, vomiting of bright red blood; pain and sick feeling in stomach.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Difficult breathing; cough with vomiting of blood; pulse very weak.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Acalypha; Millefol; Thlaspi; Ipecac*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: First potency.

filix-mas.name: Filix Mas
filix-mas.essence: A remedy for worm symptoms, especially with constipation. Tapeworm. Soporific conditions. *Torpid inflammations of lymphatic glands* (Maceration of fresh root). Pulmonary tuberculosis in young patients, no fever, with limited, ulcerated lesions, formerly classified as scrofula.
filix-mas.dosing: First to third potency. For the expulsion of tapeworm, a full dose of 1/2 to 1 dram of the Oleoresin, fasting.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Male Fern (ASPIDIUM)
A remedy for worm symptoms, especially with constipation. Tapeworm. Soporific conditions. *Torpid inflammations of lymphatic glands* (Maceration of fresh root). Pulmonary tuberculosis in young patients, no fever, with limited, ulcerated lesions, formerly classified as scrofula.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Blindness, monocular amblyopia.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Bloated.--Gnawing-pain; worse eating sweets. Diarrhoea and vomiting. Worm colic, with itching of nose, pale face, blue rings around eyes. Painless hiccough.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Aspidium Alhamanticum*.--Panna -3 doses, 2 grammes each, all in half hour, fasting in a glass of milk. Tasteless and will remove tape worm. *Cina; Granat; Kousso*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: First to third potency. For the expulsion of tapeworm, a full dose of 1/2 to 1 dram of the Oleoresin, fasting.

fluoricum-acidum.name: Fluoricum Acidum
fluoricum-acidum.essence:
Especially adapted to chronic diseases with syphilitic and mercurial history. *Glabella region bloated*. Acts especially upon lower tissues, and indicated in deep, destructive processes, bedsores, ulcerations, varicose veins, and ulcers. Patient is compelled to move about energetically. Complaints of old age, or the prematurely aged, with weak, distended blood vessels. Hob-nailed liver of alcoholics.

*Goitre* (Dr. Woakes) (Kali fluoride produced bronchocele in dogs). Early decay of teeth. Old c...

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Scanty, dark. In dropsy, produces frequent and free discharge, with great relief.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Menses copious, frequent, too long. Ulceration of uterus and os. Copious and excoriating leucorrhoea. Nymphomania.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Oppression of chest, difficult breathing, great dyspnoea. Hydrothorax.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Hydrofluoric Acid
Especially adapted to chronic diseases with syphilitic and mercurial history. *Glabella region bloated*. Acts especially upon lower tissues, and indicated in deep, destructive processes, bedsores, ulcerations, varicose veins, and ulcers. Patient is compelled to move about energetically. Complaints of old age, or the prematurely aged, with weak, distended blood vessels. Hob-nailed liver of alcoholics.
*Goitre* (Dr. Woakes) (Kali fluoride produced bronchocele in dogs). Early decay of teeth. Old cases of nightly fevers, coming on periodically.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica

Feels as if burning vapor were emitted from pores. *Itching especially of the orifices*, and in spots, worse warmth. Nails grow rapidly. Periosteal abscess. Profuse, sour, offensive perspiration. Syphilitic tubercles. *Dropsy of limbs* in old, feeble constitutions. Atony of capillary and venous system. Tissues bloated.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica

Compare: *Thiosinaminum* (action on cicatricial tissues; adhesions, strictures, tumors); *Calc fluor; Silica*.
Complementary: *Silica*.

formica-rufa.name: Formica Rufa
formica-rufa.essence: An *arthritic* medicine. Gout and articular rheumatism; pains worse, motion; better, pressure. Right side most affected. Chronic gout and stiffness in joints. Acute outbursts of gouty poisons, especially when assuming the neuralgic forms. Tuberculosis, carcinoma, and lupus; chronic nephritis. Complaints from overlifting. Apoplectic diseases. *Has a marked deterrent influence on the formation of polypi*.

agg: cold and cold washing, dampness, before a snowstorm

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Rheumatic pains; stiff and contracted joints. Muscles feel strained and torn from their attachment. *Weakness of lower extremities*. Paraplegia. Pain in hips. *Rheumatism comes on with suddenness and restlessness. Sweat does not relieve*. Relief after midnight and from rubbing.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Red, itching and burning*. Nettle-rash. Nodes around joints (*Ammon phos*). Profuse sweat without relief.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, cold and cold washing, dampness, before a snowstorm. *Better*, warmth, *pressure*, rubbing. Combing hair.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Compare: *Formic acid* (Chronic myalgia. Muscular pains and soreness. Gout and articular rheumatism, which appear suddenly. Pains usually worse on right side, motion and better from pressure. *Failing vision*. Increases muscular strength and resistance to fatigue. Feels stronger and more "fit" in ordinary walking. Marked diuretic effect, greater elimination of products of disassimilation, particularly urea. *Tremor*. Tuberculosis, chronic nephritis and carcinoma, lupus, etc, have been treated successfully with injections of Formic acid of a dilution corresponding to the 3d and 4th centesimal. In prescribing it for varicose veins, polypi, catarrh, Dr. J. H. Clarke orders an ounce or two of a solution of Formic acid in the proportion of one part of the acid to eleven of distilled water. Of this one teaspoonful is taken in a tablespoonful of water after food once or twice daily. Pain in aponeurosis and muscles of head, neck and shoulders before a snowstorm). Rhus; (*Dulcam, Urtica* and *Juniperus* contain *Formic acid*), *Wood alcohol*, when taken as a constituent of a beverage so common in these prohibition days, is not eliminated easily and is slowly converted into *Formic acid*, attacking the brain and causes death or blindness.
Dr. Sylwestrowicz of the Hering Research Laboratory of Hahnemann College, Philadelphia contributes his experience with *Formic Acid*, as follows:
"The best field for the formic acid treatment are cases of atypical gout. Under this classification are to be mentioned disturbances in the muscles such as myositis, periostitic processes of the bones in form of doughy swellings, changes of the fascias such as Dupyutren's contraction, skin troubles such as chronic eczema, psoriasis and loss of hair, kidney disturbances such as subacute and chronic nephritis. In these cases *formic acid* in 12x and 30x, hypodermically 1 cc is indicated at intervals of 2-4 weeks. Eight till twelve days after the first injection an aggravation is often noticed.
In acute rheumatic fever and acute gonorrhoeic arthritis *formic acid* 6x, every six days 1 cc, sometimes 12x in sensitive patients shows often splendid results abolishing the pains and preventing reoccurrence.
Chronic arthritis needs a special discussion. Clinical experiments of the Hering research Laboratory of the Hahnemann Medical College of Philadelphia on a great number of cases of arthritis with *formic acid* showed that it preferably acts on the ligaments, capsula and bursa of the joints. Such kind of cases respond very readily to treatment.
The prognosis depends to a large extent upon the etiology of the case. The most satisfactory cases are chronic arthritis in connection with gouty diathesis. Chronic arthritis following an attack of acute rheumatic fever shows also remarkable results although often pains of a neuralgic character persisting in certain spots are very stubborn. Finally chronic arthritis of traumatic nature can be cured by formic acid. In the latter case *formic acid* 6x showed quicker and better results than 12x or 30x which are indicated in the previous cases. In general the disappearance of the stiffness of the joint is the first sign of improvement. Then the pain and swelling cease gradually in 1-6 months time.
The prognosis of the formic acid treatment is not so favorably in chronic arthritis in which deformans processes have already taken place on the articular surfaces. Such processes in the beginning can be checked completely, advanced cases frequently show an improvement. But there is always the possibility that this improvement is only temporary. This is particularly to be expected in the cases of the so-called arthritis deformans in which even the inflammations on the ligaments and capsula are of a very progressive character".

formalinum.dosing: As vapor in hot water in respiratory affections; 1 per cent spray, otherwise 3x potency.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Aqueous Solution (35 per cent) of Formaldehyde Gas (FORMALIN)
Is a powerful disinfectant and deodorant; a potent poison. Prevents growth and kills almost any pathogenic micro-organism. It seems to have the peculiar property of eating into malignant tumors, leaving the surrounding healthy tissue uncharred and unchanged. A plug of cotton wool soaked in a 20 per cent solution of Formaldehyde, and applied for a few hours, will produce a necrotic slough, which must be scraped away before the next application, otherwise it hardens.
*Formalin in hot water as vapor most valuable therapeutic agent in pertussis*, phthisis, in catarrhal affections of upper air-passages.

Also, *Urotropin* (A diuretic and solvent of uric acid concretions; relieves cystitis associated with putrefaction. Three to five grains well diluted. When administered invariably appears in the cerebro-spinal fluid and therefore advised in threatened meningeal infection).

Proving by Dr. A. Whiting Vancouver.

materiaMedica.text: Smarting and burning. Intense erythema, worse, cold bathing; better, olive oil and cool air blowing on part.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Spiraeea*. Gaultheria contains Arbutin. *Salycyl* *acid*. *Methylium salicylicum* (an artificial Gaultheria oil for rheumatism, especially when the salicylates cannot be used. Pruritus and epididymitis, locally). After *Cantharis* in burns.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tincture and lower potencies.

gentiana-lutea.name: Gentiana Lutea
gentiana-lutea.essence: Stomach symptoms marked. Acts as a tonic, increasing appetite.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Vertigo, worse, rising or motion; better open air. Frontal headache, better eating and open air. Brain feels loose, head tender. Aching in eyes.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Dry. Thick saliva.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Acid risings, ravenous hunger, nausea, weight and aching in stomach. Inflation and tension of stomach and abdomen (*Pothos*). Colic, umbilical region sensitive to touch. Flatulence.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Gentiana quinque flora* (intermittent fever; dyspepsia, cholera infantum, weakness); *Gentiana cruciata* (throat symptoms in addition to similar stomach symptoms; dysphagia; vertigo with headache; pressing inward sensation in eyes; constricted throat and head and abdomen. Distention, fullness and tightness in abdomen. Creeping over body as from fleas). *Hydrast; Nux*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Yellow Gentian
Stomach symptoms marked. Acts as a tonic, increasing appetite.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: First to third attenuation.

geranium-maculatum.name: Geranium Maculatum
geranium-maculatum.essence: Habitual sick headaches. *Profuse, haemorrhages*, pulmonary and from different organs. Vomiting of blood. *Ulceration of stomach*. *Atonic and foul ulcers*. Summer complaint.
geranium-maculatum.dosing: Tincture, half-dram doses in gastric ulcer. Tincture, to third attenuation, as a general rule. Locally, in ulcers, it will destroy the pyogenic membrane.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Crane's-bill
Habitual sick headaches. *Profuse, haemorrhages*, pulmonary and from different organs. Vomiting of blood. *Ulceration of stomach*. *Atonic and foul ulcers*. Summer complaint.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Giddiness, with diplopia; better, closing eyes. Ptosis and dilated pupils. Sick headache.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Dry; tip of tongue burning. Pharyngitis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Catarrhal gastritis with profuse secretion, tendency to ulceration and passive haemorrhage. *Lessens the vomiting in gastric ulcer*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Constant desire to go to stool, with inability to pass anything for some time. Chronic diarrhoea, with offensive mucus. Constipation.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Menses too profuse. Post-partum haemorrhage. Sore nipples (*Eup arom*).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Geranin* 1x. Constant hawking and spitting in elderly people. *Erodium*-Hemlock-Stork's bill--(a popular haemostatic in Russia, and especially used for metrorrhagia and menorrhagia); *Hydrastinin; Cinch; Sabin*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tincture, half-dram doses in gastric ulcer. Tincture, to third attenuation, as a general rule. Locally, in ulcers, it will destroy the pyogenic membrane.

gettysburg-aqua.name: Gettysburg Aqua
gettysburg-aqua.essence: *Stringy mucus* from throat and posterior nares. *Rawness*. Neck muscles rigid. Joints weak. Cannot lift things. *Ligaments rigid*. Subacute gouty state. Evaporated and residium triturated to 6x. Of use in sub-acute and chronic rheumatism. White coated tongue. High colored urine with red sandy sedim...

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Stringy mucus* from throat and posterior nares. *Rawness*. Neck muscles rigid. Joints weak. Cannot lift things. *Ligaments rigid*. Subacute gouty state. Evaporated and residium triturated to 6x. Of use in sub-acute and chronic rheumatism. White coated tongue. High colored urine with red sandy sediment. Sensation of rigidity *worse moving*. Especially in lumbar region and joints of hips, shoulders and wrists. *Not perceived when quiet*. More in morning. Cannot remain long in one position. Stiffness of muscles on moving. Pain in ligaments relieved by rest.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Lycopodium*, Phosphor. Rhus Pulsat, but modalities differ.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, stiffness of muscles on moving. *Better*, rest (ligaments and stiffness of muscles).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Lower triturations. Also thirtieth potency.

ginseng-quinquefolium.name: Ginseng Quinquefolium
ginseng-quinquefolium.essence: Said to be a stimulant to the secretory glands, especially salivary. Acts on the lower part of the spinal cord. *Lumbago, sciatica, and rheumatism*. Paralytic weakness. *Hiccough*. Skin symptoms, itching pimples on neck and chest.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Aralia Quinquefolia-Wild Ginseng-Panax (GINSENG)
Said to be a stimulant to the secretory glands, especially salivary. Acts on the lower part of the spinal cord. *Lumbago, sciatica, and rheumatism*. Paralytic weakness. *Hiccough*. Skin symptoms, itching pimples on neck and chest.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Vertigo, with gray spots before eyes; semi-lateral headache; occipital; difficult opening of eyelids; objects appear double.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tonsillitis, just like Bellad, but in dark-complexioned people.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tense, painful, rumbling. Pain in right side. Loud gurgling in ileo-caecal region. Perityphlitis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Rheumatic pains after frequent emissions. Weakness of genital organs. Voluptuous tickling at end of urethra. Sexual excitement. Pressure in testicles.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Hands feel swollen. Skin feels tight. Contraction. Coldness in back and spine. Bruised pain in small of back and thighs; nightly digging in right lower limb to toes. Burning heat in tips of fingers. Eruption on upper inner thighs. *Stiff, contracted joints*, heaviness of lower limbs. Crackling in joints. Stiffness in back.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Aral; Coca. Hedera*-Ivy-mental depression and skin irritation antidoted by Gunpowder.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tincture, to third potency.

glonoinum.name: Glonoinum
glonoinum.essence:
Recent German provings of Glonoine confirm the original American provings and clinical indications and bring out very marked nerve disturbances. Great lassitude, no inclination to work; extreme irritability, easily excited by the slightest opposition, ending in congestive head symptoms. The sixth potency alone produced itching all over body with later acne and furuncle formation, also bulimy.

Great remedy for congestive headaches, hyperaemia of the brain from excess of heat or cold. Excellent f...

agg: exposure to sun-rays, gas, open fire

complementary: Amyl nit; Bellad; Opium; Stram; Verat vir

glonoinum.dosing:
Sixth to thirtieth potency.
For palliative (non-homeopathic) purposes, in angina pectoris, asthma, heart-failure, etc, physiological doses-i.e, 1-100 of drop-must be given. Here it is the great emergency remedy. The conditions calling for it are small, wiry pulse, pallor, arterial spasm, anaemia of brain, *collapse*, feeble heart, syncope, dicrotic pulse, vertigo,-the opposite of those indicating a homeopathic dosage. Often thus used to lower the arterial tension in chronic interstitial nephritis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.section: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text:
Nitro-glycerine--Spirits Glycerinus Nitrate
Recent German provings of Glonoine confirm the original American provings and clinical indications and bring out very marked nerve disturbances. Great lassitude, no inclination to work; extreme irritability, easily excited by the slightest opposition, ending in congestive head symptoms. The sixth potency alone produced itching all over body with later acne and furuncle formation, also bulimy.
Great remedy for congestive headaches, hyperaemia of the brain from excess of heat or cold. Excellent for the intercranial, climacteric disturbances, or due to menstrual suppression. Children get sick when sitting before an open fire. *Surging of blood to head and heart*. Tendency to sudden and violent irregularities of the circulation. Violent convulsions, associated with cerebral congestion. *Sensation of pulsation throughout body*. *Pulsating pains*. Cannot recognize localities. Sciatica in other-omatous subjects, with cold shriveled limbs; seasickness.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: *Confusion*, with dizziness. Effects of sunstroke; heat on head, as in type-setters and workers under gas and electric light. *Head heavy, but cannot lay it on pillow. Cannot bear any heat about head*. Better from uncovering head. *Throbbing headache*. Angio-spastic neuralgia of head and face. Very irritable. Vertigo on assuming upright position. Cerebral congestion. Head feels enormously large, as if skull were too small for brain. Sun headaches; increases and decreases with the sun. Shocks in head, synchronous with pulse. Headache in place of menses. Rush of blood to head in pregnant women. Threatened apoplexy. Meningitis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: See everything half light, half dark. Letters appear smaller. Sparks before eyes.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: Pulsating toothache.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: Throbbing; each beat of heart is heard in ears; full feeling.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: Flushed, hot, livid, pale; sweaty; pains in root of nose; faceache. Dusky face.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: Neck feels full. Collars must be opened. Chokes and swells up under ears.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: Gastralgia in anaemic patients with feeble circulation. Nausea and vomiting. Faint, gnawing, and empty feeling at pit of stomach. Abnormal hunger.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: Constipation with itching, painful haemorrhoids, with pinching in abdomen before and after stool. Diarrhoea; copious blackish, lumpy stools.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: Menses delayed, or sudden cessation with congestion to head. Climacteric flushing.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: Laborious action. Fluttering. Palpitation with dyspnoea. Cannot go uphill. Any exertion brings on rush of blood to heart and fainting spells. Throbbing in the whole body to finger-tips.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: Itching all over, worse extremities. Pain in left biceps. Drawing pain in all limbs. Backache.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text: *Better*, brandy. *Worse*, in sun; exposure to sun-rays, gas, open fire; jar, stooping, having hair cut; peaches, stimulants; lying down; from 6 am to noon; left side.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text:
Antidote: *Acon*.
Compare: *Amyl nit; Bellad; Opium; Stram; Verat vir*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.chapter: GLONOINUM : GL = Glycerin; O = Oxygen; N = Nitrogen
materiaMedica.text:
Sixth to thirtieth potency.
For palliative (non-homeopathic) purposes, in angina pectoris, asthma, heart-failure, etc, physiological doses-i.e, 1-100 of drop-must be given. Here it is the great emergency remedy. The conditions calling for it are small, wiry pulse, pallor, arterial spasm, anaemia of brain, *collapse*, feeble heart, syncope, dicrotic pulse, vertigo,-the opposite of those indicating a homeopathic dosage. Often thus used to lower the arterial tension in chronic interstitial nephritis.

glycerinum.name: Glycerinum
glycerinum.essence:
Used homeopathically, dynamized Glycerine seems to act

deeply and long, building up tissue, hence of great use in marasmus, debility, mental and physical, diabetes, etc. It disturbs nutrition in its primary action, and, secondarily, seems to improve the general state of nutrition (Dr. Wm. B. Griggs).
glycerinum.dosing: Thirtieth and higher potencies. Pure Glycerine in teaspoonful doses, t.i.d, with lemon juice for pernicious anaemia.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Glycerine
Used homeopathically, dynamized Glycerine seems to act
deeply and long, building up tissue, hence of great use in marasmus, debility, mental and physical, diabetes, etc. It disturbs nutrition in its primary action, and, secondarily, seems to improve the general state of nutrition (Dr. Wm. B. Griggs).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Feels full, throbs; mentally confused. Severe headache two days be before menstruation. Occiput feels full.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Stopped up, sneezing, irritating coryza. Sensation of crawling on mucous membrane. Post-nasal dripping.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Hacking cough with sense of weakness. Chest seems full. Influenzal pneumonia.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Fermentation, burning in stomach and oesophagus.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Profuse and frequent urination. Increased specific gravity and sugar. Diabetes.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Profuse, long-lasting flow with bearing down heaviness in uterus. General sense of exhaustion.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Rheumatic pains of a remittent type. Feet painful and hot, feel enlarged.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Lactic acid; Gelsemium; Calc*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Thirtieth and higher potencies. Pure Glycerine in teaspoonful doses, t.i.d, with lemon juice for pernicious anaemia.

gnaphalium-polycephalum.name: Gnaphalium Polycephalum
gnaphalium-polycephalum.essence: A remedy of unquestioned benefit in sciatica, when pain is associated with *numbness* of the part affected. Rheumatism and morning diarrhoea. Polyuria.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Cud-weed-Old Balsa (GNAPHALIUM)
A remedy of unquestioned benefit in sciatica, when pain is associated with *numbness* of the part affected. Rheumatism and morning diarrhoea. Polyuria.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Intermittent pains of superior maxillary of both sides.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Borborygmus. Colic; pain in various parts of the abdomen. Irritated prostate. First stage of cholera infantum; vomiting and purging.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Weight and fullness in pelvis. *Dysmenorrhoea*, with scanty and painful menses.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Chronic backache in lumbar region; better resting on back. Lumbago with numbness in lower part of back and weight in pelvis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Cramps in calves of legs and feet when in bed. Rheumatic pain in ankle joints and legs. *Intense pain along the sciatic nerve; numbness alternates with pain*. Frequent pains in calves and feet. Gouty pains in big toes. Better, drawing limbs up, flexing thigh on abdomen. Gouty concretions (*Ammon benz*). Anterior crural neuralgia (*Staph*). Pain in joints as if they lacked oil. Chronic muscular rheumatism of back and neck.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Xanthoxyl; Chamom; Pulsat.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third to thirtieth potency.

golondrina.name: Golondrina
golondrina.essence: An antidote to snake-poison. Its use also renders the body immune to the influence of the snake venom, and thus as a prophylactic (*Indigo*).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
**(GOLONDRINA)**
An antidote to snake-poison. Its use also renders the body immune to the influence of the snake venom, and thus as a prophylactic (*Indigo*).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *The Euphorbias. Euphorbia Prostata*--(Used by Indians as an infallible remedy against bites of poisonous insects and snakes, especially the rattle-snake). *Plumeria cellinus* Tincture internally and locally every 15 minutes for snake poisoning (Dr. Correa). *Cedron*. *Micania guacho*, a Brazilian snake cure. *Selaginella*--(Macerate in milk, locally and internally for bites of snakes and spiders). *Iodium*, tincture for rattle snake bites externally and one drop doses every 10 minutes. *Gymnema sylvestre* (will abolish the taste of bitter things; *sense of taste altered*; powdered root for snake-bite); *Sisyrinchium*-Blue-eyed grass-Ten to fifteen drop doses of tincture (rattlesnake bites).

gossypium-herbaceum.name: Gossypium Herbaceum
gossypium-herbaceum.essence: A powerful emmenagogue, used in physiological doses. Homeopathically, it corresponds to many reflex conditions, depending on disturbed uterine function and pregnancy. Gossypium will relieve tardy menses, especially with sensation that the flow is about to start and yet does not do so. Tall, bloodless patients, with nervous chills.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Cotton-plant (GOSSYPIUM)
A powerful emmenagogue, used in physiological doses. Homeopathically, it corresponds to many reflex conditions, depending on disturbed uterine function and pregnancy. Gossypium will relieve tardy menses, especially with sensation that the flow is about to start and yet does not do so. Tall, bloodless patients, with nervous chills.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain in cervical region with tendency for head to draw backward with nervousness.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Nausea, with inclination to vomit before breakfast. Anorexia, with uneasy feeling at scrobiculum at time of menses.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Labia swollen and itching. *Intermittent pain in ovaries*. Retained placenta. Tumor of the breast with swelling of axillary glands. Morning sickness, with sensitive uterine region. Suppressed menstruation. Menses too watery. Backache, weight and dragging in pelvis. Uterine sub-involution and fibroids, with gastric pain and debility.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: Action similar to Ergot when made from fresh green root. *Lilium; Cimicif; Sabina*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tincture, to sixth attenuation.

granatum.name: Granatum
granatum.essence: As a vermifuge for the expulsion of tapeworm, and homeopathically for the following symptomatic indications. *Salivation*, with nausea, and vertigo. Spasm of the glottis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Pomegranate
As a vermifuge for the expulsion of tapeworm, and homeopathically for the following symptomatic indications. *Salivation*, with nausea, and vertigo. Spasm of the glottis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Feels empty. Sunken eyes; pupils dilated; weak sight. *Vertigo very persistent*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Constant hunger*. Poor digestion. Loses flesh. Vomiting at night.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain in stomach and abdomen; worse *about umbilicus* (*Cocc; Nux m; Plumb*); ineffectual urging. Itching at anus. Dragging in vaginal region, as if hernia would protrude. Swelling resembling umbilical hernia.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Oppressed, with sighing. Pain between shoulders; even clothing is oppressive.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Itching in palms*. Sensation as if pimples would break out. Jaundiced complexion.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain around shoulders, as if heavy load had been carried. Pain in all finger-joints. Tearing in knee-joint. Convulsive movements.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Pelletierine* (one of its constituents -an anthelminitic, especially for tapeworm); *Cina; Kousso*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: First to third potency.

gratiola-officinalis.name: Gratiola Officinalis
gratiola-officinalis.essence: Acts especially on gastro-intestinal tract. Chronic catarrhal conditions, leucorrhoea and gonorrhoea. Obstinate ulcers. Useful in mental troubles from overweening pride. Especially useful in females. Nux symptoms in females often met by Gratiola.

complementary: Dig; Euph; Tab; Cham; Ammon pic; Nux vom

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Hedge Hyssop (GRATIOLA)
Acts especially on gastro-intestinal tract. Chronic catarrhal conditions, leucorrhoea and gonorrhoea. Obstinate ulcers. Useful in mental troubles from overweening pride. Especially useful in females. Nux symptoms in females often met by Gratiola.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Sick headache. *Rush of blood* with vanishing of sight. Sensation as if brain was contracting and head became smaller. Tightness in forehead, with wrinkles in skin. Eyes dry, burn. Myopia.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Vertigo during and after meals; hunger and feeling of emptiness after meals. Dyspepsia, with much distention of the stomach. Cramps and colic after supper and during night, with swelling of abdomen and constipation. Dysphagia for liquids.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Diarrhoea; *green, frothy water*, followed by anal burning, *forcibly evacuated without pain. Constipation*, with gouty acidity. Haemorrhoids, with hypochondriasis. Rectum constricted.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Insomnia.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Nymphomania*. Menses too profuse, premature, and too long. Leucorrhoea.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, drinking too much water.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Dig; Euph; Tab; Cham; Ammon pic; Nux vom*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Second to third potency.

grindelia-robusta.name: Grindelia Robusta
grindelia-robusta.essence:
Both Grindelia robusta and Grindelia squarrosa have been used for the symptoms here recorded. There is practically no difference in their action, although the G. Squarrosa is credited with more splenic symptoms, dull pains and fullness in left hypochondrium; chronic malaria; gastric pains associated with *splenic* congestion. Induces paralysis, beginning in extremities Its action is shown on the heart first quickening, then retarding it.

Acts on the cardio-pulmonary distribution of the pneumo-g...
grindelia-robusta.dosing: Tincture in 1 to 15 drop doses, also lower potencies.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Feels full, as from quinine. Pain in *eyeballs*, running back to brain; worse, moving eyes. Pupils dilated. Purulent ophthalmia and iritis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Rosin-wood (GRINDELIA)
Both Grindelia robusta and Grindelia squarrosa have been used for the symptoms here recorded. There is practically no difference in their action, although the G. Squarrosa is credited with more splenic symptoms, dull pains and fullness in left hypochondrium; chronic malaria; gastric pains associated with *splenic* congestion. Induces paralysis, beginning in extremities Its action is shown on the heart first quickening, then retarding it.
Acts on the cardio-pulmonary distribution of the pneumo-gastric in dry catarrh (Tart Emetic in muco-purulent). Produces a paresis of the pneumo-gastric, interfering with respiration. *Smothering after falling asleep*. Asthmatic conditions, chronic bronchitis. Bronchorrhoea with tough mucus, difficult to detach. Raises the blood pressure. Nausea and retching of gastric ulcer. Sugar in urine. An effective antidote to Rhus-poisoning, locally and internally; also for burns, blisters, vaginal catarrh and herpes zoster. Hyperchlorhydria when attended with asthmatic and other neurotic symptoms. Hyperaemia of gastric mucous membrane with difficult respiration.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: An efficacious remedy for wheezing and oppression in bronchitic patients. The sibilant rales are disseminated with foamy mucus, very difficult to detach. Acts on the pulmonary circulation. Asthma, with profuse tenacious expectoration, which relieves. *Stops breathing when falling asleep*; wakes *with a star*, and gasps for breath. Must sit up to breathe. *Cannot breathe when lying down*. Pertussis, with profuse mucous secretion (*Coccus*). Bronchorrhoea, with tough, whitish, mucous expectoration. Sibilant rales. Weak heart and respiration. Cannot breathe lying down. Cheyne-Stokes respiration.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Cutting pain in region of spleen, extending to hips. Spleen enlarged (*Ceanoth; Carduus*).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Rash, like roseola, with severe burning and itching. Vesicular and papular eruptions. Herpes zoster. Itching and burning. *Poison oak* (locally as a wash). Ulcers, with swollen, purplish skin.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Tart-emet. Eriodictyon; Lach; Sanguinar*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tincture in 1 to 15 drop doses, also lower potencies.

mikania-guaco.name: Mikania Guaco
mikania-guaco.essence:
Acts on nervous system and female organs. Antidote to bites of scorpions and serpents (*Golondrina*). Cholera. *Bulbar paralysis. Syphilis*. Cancer. Deafness-tongue heavy and difficult to move. *Spinal irritation*. Spinal symptoms most marked and verified. Beer drinkers threatened with apoplexy. *Diarrhoea and dysentery with aching in sacrum and loins*.

Headache, red face. Heaviness and difficulty in moving tongue.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Mikania, Climbing Hemp Weed
Acts on nervous system and female organs. Antidote to bites of scorpions and serpents (*Golondrina*). Cholera. *Bulbar paralysis. Syphilis*. Cancer. Deafness-tongue heavy and difficult to move. *Spinal irritation*. Spinal symptoms most marked and verified. Beer drinkers threatened with apoplexy. *Diarrhoea and dysentery with aching in sacrum and loins*.
Headache, red face. Heaviness and difficulty in moving tongue.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Larynx and trachea constricted; difficult deglutition. Tongue feels heavy, difficult to move.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Leucorrhoea copious, corroding, putrid, debilitating. Itching and smarting at night, as if fire were running out of parts.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Increased, cloudy, phosphatic. Pain over region of bladder.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain between scapulae, extending to forearm. Burning in nape of shoulders. *Pain along spine; worse*, bending. Weariness through hips and lumbar region.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain in deltoid, shoulders, elbows, arms, and fingers. Pain about hip-joint. Legs heavy. Pain in ankle-joints and soles. *Paralysis of lower extremities*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, from motion.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Oxal ac; Lathyr; Caust*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third to sixth potency.

guajacum-officinale.name: Guajacum Officinale
guajacum-officinale.essence: Chief action on fibrous tissue, and is especially adapted to the arthritic diathesis, rheumatism, and tonsillitis. Secondary syphilis. Very valuable in acute rheumatism. *Free foul secretions. Unclean odor from whole body*. Promotes suppuration of abscesses. Sensitiveness and aggravation from local heat.
