materiaMedica.text: Lower potencies.

rumex-crispus.name: Rumex Crispus
rumex-crispus.essence: Is characterized by pains, numerous and varied, neither fixed nor constant anywhere. Cough caused by an incessant tickling in the throat-pit, which tickling runs down to the bifurcation of the bronchial tubes. Touching the throat-pit brings on the cough. Worse from the least cold air; so that all cough ceases by covering up all the body and head with the bedclothes. Rumex diminishes the secretions of mucous membranes, and at the same time exalts sensibility of the mucous membranes of the larynx ...

agg: in evening, from inhaling cold air

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Yellow Dock
Is characterized by pains, numerous and varied, neither fixed nor constant anywhere. Cough caused by an incessant tickling in the throat-pit, which tickling runs down to the bifurcation of the bronchial tubes. Touching the throat-pit brings on the cough. Worse from the least cold air; so that all cough ceases by covering up all the body and head with the bedclothes. Rumex diminishes the secretions of mucous membranes, and at the same time exalts sensibility of the mucous membranes of the larynx and trachea. Its action upon the skin is marked, producing an intense itching. *Lymphatics enlarged* and secretions perverted.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tongue sore at edges; coated; sensation of hard substance in pit of stomach; hiccough, pyrosis, nausea; *cannot eat meat; it causes eructations, pruritus*. Jaundice after excessive use of alcoholics. Chronic gastritis; aching pain in pit of stomach and shooting in the chest; extends towards the throat-pit, worse any motion or talking. Pain in left breast after meals; *flatulence*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Nose dry. *Tickling in throat-pit causes cough. Copious mucous discharge* from nose and trachea. *Dry, teasing cough, preventing sleep. Aggravated by pressure, talking, and especially by inspiring cool air and at night*. Thin, watery, frothy expectoration by the mouthful: later, stringy and tough. Rawness of larynx and trachea. Soreness behind sternum, especially left side, in region of left shoulder. *Raw pain under clavicle*. Lump in throat.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Brown, watery, diarrhoea *early in morning*, with cough, driving him out of bed. Valuable in advanced phthisis (*Seneg; Puls; Lycop; Ars*). Itching of anus, with sensation as of a stick in rectum. Piles.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Intense itching of skin, especially of *lower extremities; worse, exposure to cold air when undressing*. Urticaria; contagious prurigo.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, in evening, from inhaling cold air; left chest; uncovering.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Caust; Sulph; Bell*; Rumex contains chrysophanic acid to which the skin symptoms correspond. *Rumex acetosa*-Sheep sorrel--(Gathered in June and dried, used locally for Epithelioma of face (Cowperthwaite). Dry, unremitting short cough, and violent pains in the bowels; uvula elongated; inflammation of oesophagus; also cancer); *Rumex obtusifolius-Lapathum*-Broad-leaf dock--(nosebleed and headache following; pain in kidneys; leucorrhoea).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third to sixth potency.

ruta-graveolens.name: Ruta Graveolens
ruta-graveolens.essence: Acts upon the periosteum and cartilages, eyes and uterus. Complaints from straining *flexor tendons* especially. Tendency to the formation of deposits in the periosteum, tendons, and about joints, especially wrist. Overstrain of ocular muscles. All parts of the body are painful, *as if bruised*. Sprains (after *Arnica*). Lameness after sprains. Jaundice. *Feeling of intense lassitude, weakness and despair*. Injured "bruised" bones.

agg: lying down, from cold, wet weather

ruta-graveolens.dosing: First to sixth potency. Locally, the tincture for ganglia and as a lotion for the eyes.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Rue-bitterwort
Acts upon the periosteum and cartilages, eyes and uterus. Complaints from straining *flexor tendons* especially. Tendency to the formation of deposits in the periosteum, tendons, and about joints, especially wrist. Overstrain of ocular muscles. All parts of the body are painful, *as if bruised*. Sprains (after *Arnica*). Lameness after sprains. Jaundice. *Feeling of intense lassitude, weakness and despair*. Injured "bruised" bones.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain as from a nail; after excessive intoxicating drinks. Periosteum sore. Epistaxis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Eyes-strain followed by headache. Eyes red, hot, and painful from sewing or reading fine print* (*Nat mur; Arg nit*). *Disturbances of accommodation*. Weary pain while reading. Pressure deep in orbits. Tarsal cartilage feels bruised. Pressure over eyebrow. Asthenopia.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Gastralgia of aching, gnawing character.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pressure in neck of bladder after urinating; painful closure (*Apis*). Constant urging to urinate, feels bladder full.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Difficult feces*, evacuated only with straining. Constipation, alternating with mucous, frothy stools; discharge of blood with stool. When sitting, tearing stitches in rectum. *Carcinoma affecting lower bowel. Prolapsus ani* every time the bowels move, after confinement. Frequent, unsuccessful urging to stool. Protrusion of rectum when stooping.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Cough with copious, thick, yellow expectoration; chest feels weak. Painful spot on sternum; short breath with tightness of chest.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain in nape, back and loins. Backache better pressure and lying on back. Lumbago worse morning before rising.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Spine and limbs feel bruised. Small of back and loins pain. Legs give out on rising from a chair, hips and thighs so weak (*Phos; Con*). Contraction of fingers. Pain and stiffness in wrists and hands. Ganglia (*Benzoic ac*). Sciatica; worse, lying down at night; pain from back down hips and thighs. Hamstrings feel shortened (*Graph*). *Tendons sore*. Aching pain in tendo-Achilles. *Thighs pain when stretching the limbs*. Pain in bones of feet and ankles. Great restlessness.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, lying down, from cold, wet weather.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Compare: *Ratanhia; Carduus*. Rectal (irritation); *Jaborandi; Phyt; Rhus; Sil; Arn*.
Antidote: *Camph*.
Complementary: *Calc phos*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: First to sixth potency. Locally, the tincture for ganglia and as a lotion for the eyes.

sabadilla.name: Sabadilla
sabadilla.essence: Action on mucous membrane of the nose and the lachrymal glands, producing coryza and symptoms like *hay-fever*, which have been utilized homeopathically. *Chilliness*; sensitive to cold. Ascarides, with reflex symptoms (nymphomania; convulsive symptoms). Children's diarrhoea with constant cutting pains.

agg: cold and cold drinks, full moon
amel: warm food and drink, wrapped up

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Cevadilla Seed. Asagraea Officialis
Action on mucous membrane of the nose and the lachrymal glands, producing coryza and symptoms like *hay-fever*, which have been utilized homeopathically. *Chilliness*; sensitive to cold. Ascarides, with reflex symptoms (nymphomania; convulsive symptoms). Children's diarrhoea with constant cutting pains.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Nervous, timid, easily startled. Has erroneous notions about himself. Imagines that he is very sick; that parts are shrunken; that she is pregnant; that she has cancer; delirium during intermittents.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Vertigo with sensation as though all things were turning around each other, accompanied by blackness before eyes and sensation of fainting. Dullness and oppression. Over-sensitiveness to odors. *Thinking* produces headache and sleeplessness. *Eyelids red, burning. Lachrymation*. Difficult hearing.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Spasmodic sneezing, with running nose. Coryza*, with severe frontal pains and redness of eyes and lachrymation. Copious, watery, nasal discharge.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Sore; *begins on left side* (*Lach*). Much tough phlegm. Sensation of a skin hanging loosely; must swallow it. *Warm food and drink relieve*. Empty swallowing most painful. Dry fauces and throat. Sensation of a lump in throat with *constant* necessity to swallow. Chronic sore throat; worse, from cold air. Tongue as if burnt.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Spasmodic pain in stomach with dry cough and difficult breathing. *No thirst*. Loathing for strong food. Canine appetite for sweets and farinaceous food. Pyrosis; copious salivation. Cold, empty feeling in stomach. *Desire for hot things. Sweetish* taste.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Menses too late; come by fits and starts. *Intermit* (*Kreos; Puls*). (due to transient and localized congestion of womb alternating with chronic anaemic state).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Chill predominates*; from below upwards. Heat in head and face; hands and feet icy cold, with chill. Lachrymation during paroxysm. Thirstless.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Cracking of skin under and beneath toe; inflammation under toe-nails.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Dry, like parchment. Horny, deformed, *thickened nails*. Hot, burning, creeping, crawling sensation. Itching in anus.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, cold and cold drinks, full moon. *Better*, warm food and drink, wrapped up.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Complementary: *Sepia*. Compare: *Veratrina* (is alkaloid of Sabadilla, *not* of Veratrum, locally in neuralgias, and for removal of dropsy. Five grains to two drams Lanolin, rubbed on inside of thighs, causes diuresis). *Colch; Nux; Arundo* and *Pollatin*.
*Phleum pratense*-Timothy-Hay-fever-Potentized-12-specific to many cases and evidently acts in a desensitizing manner (Rabe). *Cumarinum* (hay-fever).
Antidotes: *Puls; Lycop; Conium; Lach*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third to thirtieth potency.

sabal-serrulata.name: Sabal Serrulata
sabal-serrulata.essence: Sabal is homeopathic to irritability of the genito-urinary organs. General and sexual debility. Promotes nutrition and tissue building. Head, stomach, and ovarian symptoms marked. Of unquestioned value in prostatic enlargement, *epididymitis*, and urinary difficulties. Acts on membrano-prostatic portion of urethra. Iritis, with prostatic trouble. *Valuable for undeveloped mammary glands. Fear of going to sleep*. Languor, apathy and indifference.

complementary: Phosph ac; Stigmata maydis; Santal; Apis

sabal-serrulata.dosing: Mother tincture, ten to thirty drops. Third potency often better. The tincture must be prepared from the *fresh berries* to be effective.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Saw Palmetto
Sabal is homeopathic to irritability of the genito-urinary organs. General and sexual debility. Promotes nutrition and tissue building. Head, stomach, and ovarian symptoms marked. Of unquestioned value in prostatic enlargement, *epididymitis*, and urinary difficulties. Acts on membrano-prostatic portion of urethra. Iritis, with prostatic trouble. *Valuable for undeveloped mammary glands. Fear of going to sleep*. Languor, apathy and indifference.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Confused, full; dislikes sympathy; makes her angry. Vertigo, with headache. Neuralgia in feeble patients. Pain runs up from nose and centers in forehead.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Belching and acidity. Desire for milk (*Rhus; Apis*)

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Constant desire to pass water at night. *Enuresis*; paresis of sphincter vesicae. Chronic gonorrhoea. Difficult urination. Cystitis with prostatic hypertrophy.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Prostatic troubles*; enlargement; discharge of prostatic fluid. Wasting of testes and *loss of sexual power*. Coitus painful at the time of emission. *Sexual neurotics*. Organs feel cold.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Ovaries tender and enlarged; *breasts shrivel* (*Iod; Kali iod*). Young female neurotics; suppressed or perverted sexual inclination.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Copious expectoration, with catarrh of nose. Chronic bronchitis (*Stann; Hep*).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Phosph ac; Stigmata maydis; Santal; Apis*. In prostatic symptoms: *fer pic; Thuja; Picric acid* (more sexual erethism). Populus tremul; (prostatic enlargement with cystitis).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Mother tincture, ten to thirty drops. Third potency often better. The tincture must be prepared from the *fresh berries* to be effective.

sabina.name: Sabina
sabina.essence: Has a special action on the uterus; also upon serous and fibrous membranes; hence its use in gout. *Pain from sacrum to the pubis. Haemorrhages, where blood is fluid and clots together*. Tendency to miscarriage, especially at third month. *Violent pulsations*; wants windows open.

agg: from least motion, heat, warm air

complementary: Croc; Calc; Trill; Ipec; Millef; Erig

sabina.dosing: Locally, for warts, tincture. Internally, third to thirtieth potency.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Savine
Has a special action on the uterus; also upon serous and fibrous membranes; hence its use in gout. *Pain from sacrum to the pubis. Haemorrhages, where blood is fluid and clots together*. Tendency to miscarriage, especially at third month. *Violent pulsations*; wants windows open.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Music is intolerable*, produces nervousness.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Vertigo with suppressed menses. Bursting headache, suddenly coming and going slowly. Rush of blood to head and face. Drawing pains in masseter muscles. Teeth ache when chewing.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Heartburn. Desire for lemonade. Bitter taste (*Rhus*). Lancinating pain from pit of stomach across back.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Bearing-down, constrictive pain. Colic, mostly in hypogastric region. Tympanitic distention.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Sense of fullness. Constipation. *Pain from back to pubis*. Haemorrhoids, with bright red blood; bleed copiously.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Burning and throbbing in region of kidneys. Bloody urine; much urging. Bladder inflamed with throbbing all over. Inflammation of urethra.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Inflammatory gonorrhoea, with pus-like discharge. Sycotic excrescences. Burning, sore pain in glans. Prepuce painful with difficulty in retracting it. Increased desire.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
*Menses profuse, bright*. Uterine pains extend into thighs. Threatened miscarriage. Sexual desire increased. Leucorrhoea after menses, corrosive, offensive. Discharge of blood between periods, with sexual excitement (*Ambr*). Retained placenta; intense after-pains. Menorrhagia in women who aborted readily. Inflammation of ovaries and uterus after abortion. Promotes expulsion of moles from uterus (*Canth*).
*Pain from sacrum to pubis, and from below upwards shooting up the vagina*. Haemorrhage; partly clotted; worse *from least motion*. Atony of uterus.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Pain between sacrum and pubis from one bone to another*. Paralytic pain in small back.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Bruised pains in anterior portion of thighs. Shooting in heels and metatarsal bones. *Arthritic pain in joints*. Gout; worse, in heated room. Red, shining swelling. Gouty nodosities (*Ammon phos*).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Fig-warts, with intolerable itching and burning. Exuberant granulations (*Thuj; Nit ac*). *Warts*. Black pores in skin.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, from least motion, heat, warm air. *Better*, in cool fresh air.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Complementary: *Thuja*.
Compare: *Sanguisorba* (Venous congestion and passive haemorrhages; varices of lower extremities; dysentery. *Long lasting profuse menses* with congestion to head and limbs in sensitive, irritable patients. *Climacteric* haemorrhages. Use 2x attenuation). *Sanguisuga*.--The leech--(Haemorrhages, especially bleeding from anus. Use 6x). *Rosmarinus* (menses too early; violent pains followed by uterine haemorrhage. Head heavy, drowsy. Chilly with icy coldness of lower extremities without thirst, followed by heat. Memory deficient). *Croc; Calc; Trill; Ipec; Millef; Erig*.
Antidote: *Puls*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Locally, for warts, tincture. Internally, third to thirtieth potency.

saccharum-officinarum.name: Saccharum Officinarum
saccharum-officinarum.essence:
According to the great Dr. Hering, a large proportion of chronic diseases of women and children are developed by using too much sugar. Sugar is an antiseptic. Combats infection and putrefaction; has a solvent action on fibrin and stimulates secretion by the intense osmotic changes induced, thus rinsing out the wound with serum from within outward, favoring healing. Leg ulcers.

Sugar must be considered a sustainer and developer of the musculature of the heart and hence useful in failure of compe...
saccharum-officinarum.dosing:
Thirtieth potency and higher. Locally in gangrene. One ounce of lump sugar morning and evening valuable adjunct in the treatment of obstinate cases of heart failure due to deficient heart muscle without valvular lesion. Epilepsy; blood with reduced sugar content irritates the nervous system with tending to convulsions.
*Sugar* as an oxytocic has its most suitable application towards the end of labor when there is no mechanical obstruction and delay is due to uterine inertia. 25 grammes dissolved in water, several times every half hour.
Compare: *Saccharin* (hinders both the salivary and peptic ferment actions with consequent dyspepsia. Prof. Lewin believes its action to be on the secretory cells themselves and it has caused pain (right hypogastrium), loss of appetite, diarrhoea and wasting).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Cane-sugar (SUCROSE)
According to the great Dr. Hering, a large proportion of chronic diseases of women and children are developed by using too much sugar. Sugar is an antiseptic. Combats infection and putrefaction; has a solvent action on fibrin and stimulates secretion by the intense osmotic changes induced, thus rinsing out the wound with serum from within outward, favoring healing. Leg ulcers.
Sugar must be considered a sustainer and developer of the musculature of the heart and hence useful in failure of compensation and a variety of cardio-vascular troubles. Acts as a nutrient and tonic, in wasting disorders, anaemia, neurasthenia, etc, increasing weight and power.
Opacity of cornea. Dim sight. *Acidity and anal itching*. Cold expectoration. Myocardial degeneration.
Fat, bloated, large-limbed children, who are *cross*,
*peevish*, whining; capricious; want dainty things, tidbits, and refuse substantial food. OEdema of feet. Headache every seven days

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Saccharum lactis*-Sugar of milk-lactose--(diuresis; amblyopia; *cold pains*, as if produced by fine, icy cold needle with tingling, as if frost bitten; great physical exhaustion. *Sugar of milk* in large doses to develop the Bacillus acidophilus to correct putrefactive intestinal conditions and also constipation).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Thirtieth potency and higher. Locally in gangrene. One ounce of lump sugar morning and evening valuable adjunct in the treatment of obstinate cases of heart failure due to deficient heart muscle without valvular lesion. Epilepsy; blood with reduced sugar content irritates the nervous system with tending to convulsions.
*Sugar* as an oxytocic has its most suitable application towards the end of labor when there is no mechanical obstruction and delay is due to uterine inertia. 25 grammes dissolved in water, several times every half hour.
Compare: *Saccharin* (hinders both the salivary and peptic ferment actions with consequent dyspepsia. Prof. Lewin believes its action to be on the secretory cells themselves and it has caused pain (right hypogastrium), loss of appetite, diarrhoea and wasting).

salicylicum-acidum.name: Salicylicum Acidum
salicylicum-acidum.essence: The symptoms point to its use in rheumatism, dyspepsia, and *Meniere's disease*. Prostration after influenza; also tinnitus aurium and deafness. Haematuria.
salicylicum-acidum.dosing: Third decimal trituration. In acute articular rheumatism, 5 grains every 3 hours (Old school dose).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Salicylic Acid
The symptoms point to its use in rheumatism, dyspepsia, and *Meniere's disease*. Prostration after influenza; also tinnitus aurium and deafness. Haematuria.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Vertigo; tendency to fall to left side. Headache; confusion in head on rising suddenly. Incipient coryza. Piercing pain in temples.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Retinal haemorrhage. Retinitis after influenza, also albuminuric.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Roaring and ringing in ears*. Deafness, with vertigo.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Sore, red and swollen. Pharyngitis; swallowing difficult.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Canker sores*, with burning soreness and fetid breath. *Flatulence; hot, sour belching*. Putrid fermentation. *Fermentative dyspepsia*. Tongue purplish, leaden-colored; foul breath.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Putrid diarrhoea; gastro-intestinal derangements, especially in children; stools like green frog's spawn (*Magn carb*). Pruritus ani.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Knees swollen and painful. Acute articular rheumatism; worse, touch and motion, profuse sweat. Pain shifts. Sciatica, burning pain; worse at night. Copious foot-sweat and ill affects where suppressed.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Itching vesicles and pustules; better by scratching. Sweat without sleep. Urticaria. Hot and burning skin. Purpura. Herpes zoster. Necrosis and softening of bones.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Salol* (rheumatic pain in joints, with soreness and stiffness, headache over eyes; urine violet-smelling); *Colch; China; Lact ac*. Spiraea and Gaultheria contain salicyl acid.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third decimal trituration. In acute articular rheumatism, 5 grains every 3 hours (Old school dose).

salvia-officinalis.name: Salvia Officinalis
salvia-officinalis.essence: Controls excessive sweating when circulation is enfeebled; of less use in phthisis *with night-sweats* and suffocating tickling cough. Galactorrhoea. Exerts a tonic influence on the skin.
salvia-officinalis.dosing: Tincture, in twenty-drop doses, in a little water. The effects manifest themselves quickly two hours after taking a dose, and they persist for from two to six days.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Sage
Controls excessive sweating when circulation is enfeebled; of less use in phthisis *with night-sweats* and suffocating tickling cough. Galactorrhoea. Exerts a tonic influence on the skin.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tickling cough, especially in consumption.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Soft, relaxed, with enfeebled circulation and cold extremities. *Colliquative perspiration*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Chrysanhemum Leucanthemum*--Ox-eye Daisy. Has specific action on sudoriparous glands. Quiets nervous system like *Cypripedium*. Right sided tearing pain in bones of jaw and temple. Pain in teeth and gums, worse touch, better warmth. Irritable and tearful. Here use 12x. *Insomnia and night-sweats*. For colliquative sweating and hyperaesthesia of nervous system. Material doses of tincture. *Phelland; Tuberc; Salvia sclerata* (tonic influence on nervous system; dose, teaspoonful to one pint hot water, as inhalent for sponging). *Rubia tinctorum*-Madder-A remedy for the spleen (*Ceanothus*). Chlorosis and amenorrhoea; tuberculosis. Anaemia; undernourished conditions; splenic anaemia. Dose, 10 drops of tincture.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tincture, in twenty-drop doses, in a little water. The effects manifest themselves quickly two hours after taking a dose, and they persist for from two to six days.

salix-nigra.name: Salix Nigra
salix-nigra.essence: Has a positive action on the generative organs of both sexes Hysteria and nervousness. Libidinous thoughts and lascivious dreams. Controls genital irritability. Moderates sexual passion. Satyriasis and erotomania. In acute gonorrhoea, with much erotic trouble; chordee. After masturbation; spermatorrhoea.
salix-nigra.dosing: Material doses of the tincture, thirty drops.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Black-willow
Has a positive action on the generative organs of both sexes Hysteria and nervousness. Libidinous thoughts and lascivious dreams. Controls genital irritability. Moderates sexual passion. Satyriasis and erotomania. In acute gonorrhoea, with much erotic trouble; chordee. After masturbation; spermatorrhoea.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Red, swollen, especially the end of nose-eyes blood-shot and sore to touch and on motion. Roots of hair hurt. Epistaxis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Before and during menses much nervous disturbance, pain in ovaries; difficult menstruation. Ovarian congestion and neuralgia. Menorrhagia. Bleeding with uterine fibroid. Nymphomania.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Painful movement of the testicles.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pain across sacral and lumbar region. Unable to step out quickly.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Yohimbin; Canth*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Material doses of the tincture, thirty drops.

sanguinaria-canadensis.name: Sanguinaria Canadensis
sanguinaria-canadensis.essence: Is a right-sided remedy pre-eminently, and affects chiefly the mucous membranes, especially of the respiratory tract. It has marked vaso-motor disturbances, as seen in the circumscribed redness of the cheeks, flashes of heat, determination of blood to head and chest, distention of temporal veins, burning in palms and soles, and has been found very applicable to climacteric disorders. *Burning* sensations, like from hot water. Influenzal coughs. Phthisis. *Sudden stopping of catarrh of respirator...

complementary: Bell; Iris; Melil; Lach; Ferr; Op

sanguinaria-canadensis.dosing: Tincture in headaches; sixth potency in rheumatism.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Blood Root (SANGUINARIA)
Is a right-sided remedy pre-eminently, and affects chiefly the mucous membranes, especially of the respiratory tract. It has marked vaso-motor disturbances, as seen in the circumscribed redness of the cheeks, flashes of heat, determination of blood to head and chest, distention of temporal veins, burning in palms and soles, and has been found very applicable to climacteric disorders. *Burning* sensations, like from hot water. Influenzal coughs. Phthisis. *Sudden stopping of catarrh of respiratory tract followed by diarrhoea. Burning* in various parts is characteristic.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Worse *right* side, sun headache. Periodical sick headache; pain begins in occiput, spreads upwards, and *settles over eyes, especially right. Veins and temples are distended*. Pain better lying down and sleep. Headaches return at climacteric; every seventh day (*Sulph; Sabad*). Pain in small spot over upper left parietal bone. Burning in eyes. Pain in the back of head "like a flash of lightning".

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Flushed. Neuralgia; pain extends in all directions from upper jaw. *Redness and burning of cheeks. Hectic flush*. Fullness and tenderness behind angle of jaws.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Hay-fever. Ozaena, with profuse, offensive yellowish discharges. *Nasal polypi*. Coryza, followed by diarrhoea. Chronic rhinitis; membrane *dry* and congested.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Burning in ears. Earache with headache. Humming and roaring. Aural polypus.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Swollen; worse, right side. Dry and constricted. Ulceration of mouth and fauces, with dry, burning sensation Tongue white; feels scalded. Tonsillitis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Aversion to butter. Craving for piquant things. Unquenchable thirst. Burning, vomiting. Nausea, with salivation. Sinking, faint all-gone feeling (*Phos; Sep*). Spitting up of bile; gastro-duodenal catarrh.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Diarrhoea as coryza improves. Pain over region of liver. Diarrhoea; bilious, liquid, gushing stool (*Nat sulph; Lycop*). Cancer of rectum.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Leucorrhoea fetid, corrosive. Menses offensive, profuse. Soreness of breasts. Uterine polypi. Before, menses, itching of axillae. Climacteric disorders.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: OEdema of larynx. Trachea sore. Heat and tension behind the sternum. Aphonia. *Cough of gastric origin*; relieved by eructation. Cough, with burning pain in chest; worse, right side. Sputum tough, *rust-colored*, offensive, almost impossible to raise. Spasmodic cough after influenza and *after whooping-cough*. Cough returns with every fresh cold. Tickling behind sternum, causes a constant hacking cough; worse at night on lying down. Must sit up in bed. Burning soreness in right chest, through to right shoulder. Severe soreness under right nipple. Haemoptysis from suppressed menses. *Severe dyspnoea* and constriction of chest. Offensive breath and purulent expectoration. Burning in chest as of hot steam from chest to abdomen. Fibroid phthisis. Pneumonia; better, lying on back. Asthma with stomach disorders (*Nux*). Valvular disease with lung development, phosphates in urine and loss of flesh. Sudden stoppage of catarrh of air passages brings on diarrhoea.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Rheumatism of right shoulder, left hip-joint and nape of neck. *Burning in soles and palms*. Rheumatic pains in places least covered by flesh; not in joints soles of feet burn. Right-side neuritis; better touching the part.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Antidotes: *Rhus poisoning*. Red, blotchy eruptions; worse in spring. Burning and itching; worse by heat. Acne, with scanty menses. Circumscribed red spots over malar bones.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, sweets, right side, motion, touch. *Better*, acids, sleep, darkness.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Complementary: *Tart em.*
Compare: *Justicia* (bronchial catarrh, coryza, hoarseness; oversensitive). *Digitalis* (Migraine). *Bell; Iris; Melil; Lach; Ferr; Op*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tincture in headaches; sixth potency in rheumatism.

sanguinarinum-nitricum.name: Sanguinarinum Nitricum
sanguinarinum-nitricum.essence: Is of use in polypus of the nose. Acute and chronic catarrh. Acute pharyngitis (*Wyethia*) Smarting and burning in throat and chest especially under sternum. *Influenza*. Lachrymation, pains in eyes and head, sore scalp; *sensee of obstruction.* chronic follicular pharyngitis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Nitrate of Sanguinarine (SANGUINARINA NITRICA)
Is of use in polypus of the nose. Acute and chronic catarrh. Acute pharyngitis (*Wyethia*) Smarting and burning in throat and chest especially under sternum. *Influenza*. Lachrymation, pains in eyes and head, sore scalp; *sensee of obstruction.* chronic follicular pharyngitis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Feels obstructed. Profuse, watery mucus, with burning pain*. Enlarged turbinates at beginning of hypertrophic process. Secretion scant, tendency to dryness. Small crusts which bleed when removed. Post-nasal secretions adherent to nasopharynx, dislodged with difficulty. Dry and burning nostrils; watery mucus, with pressure over root of nose. Nostrils plugged with thick, yellow, bloody mucus. *Sneezing*. Rawness and soreness in posterior nares.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Rough, dry, *constricted, burning*. Right tonsil sore, swallowing difficult.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Ulceration on the *side* of the tongue.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Short, hacking cough, with expectoration of thick, yellow, sweetish mucus. *Pressure behind center of sternum*. Dryness and burning in throat and bronchi. *Tickling cough*. Chronic nasal, laryngeal, and bronchial catarrh. Voice altered, deep, hoarse.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Sanguin tartaricum* (exophthalmos; *mydriasis*; dim vision); *Arum triph; Psorin; Kal bich*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third trituration.

sanicula-aqua.name: Sanicula Aqua
sanicula-aqua.essence: The Water of Sanicula Springs, Ottawa, I11 (SANICULA)

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Burning of soles of feet (*Sulph; Lach*). Offensive foot-sweat (*Sil; Psor*). Cold, clammy sweat of extremities.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Dirty, greasy, brownish, wrinkled. Eczema, fissured hands and fingers (*Petrol; Graph*).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse, moving arms backward*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
The Water of Sanicula Springs, Ottawa, I11 (SANICULA)
Has been found a useful remedy in enuresis, seasickness, constipation, etc. Rickets.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Dread of downward motion (*Borax*).
*Profuse sweat on occiput* and in nape of neck, during sleep (*Calc; Sil*). Photophobia. Lachrymation in cold air or from cold application. Profuse scaly dandruff. Soreness behind ears.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Thick, ropy, tenacious mucus.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tongue large, flabby, burning; must protrude it to keep cool. Ringworm on tongue.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Nausea and vomiting from car-riding. Thirst; drink little and often (*Ars; Chin*). Is vomited as soon as it reaches the stomach.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Stools large, heavy and painful. *Pain in whole perineum*. No desire until a large accumulation. After great straining only partially expelled; recedes, crumbles at verge of anus (*Mag mur*). Very offensive odor. Excoriation of skin about anus, perineum, and genitals. Diarrhoea; changeable in character and color; after eating.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Bearing-down, as if contents of pelvis would escape; better, rest. Desire to support parts. Soreness of uterus. Leucorrhoea with *odor of fish-brine or cold cheese* (*Hepar*). Vagina feels large.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Dislocated feeling in sacrum and better lying on right side.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Abrot; Alum; Calc; Sil; Sulph*. Sanicula Aqua must not be confounded with the Sanicle (pool-root or wood marsh), also called *Sanicula*. This is used in various nervous affections, resembling Valeriana. It is used as a vulnerary, resolvent for sanguineous extravasations, and as an astringent (Has not been proved).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Thirtieth potency.

santoninum.name: Santoninum
santoninum.essence:
Is the active principle of Santonica, the unexpanded flower heads of *Artemisia Maritima*-Cina, which see.

The eye symptoms and those of the urinary tract are most prominent. It is of unquestioned value in the treatment of worm diseases, as gastro-intestinal irritation, *itching of nose*, restless sleep, twitching of muscles. Ascaris lumbricoides, and thread worms, but not tapeworms. *Night cough* of children. *Chronic cystitis*. Laryngeal crises and lightning pains of tabes.

complementary: Cina; Teucr; Napth; Nat phos; Spigel

santoninum.dosing: Second to third trituration. Lower preparations are often toxic. Do not give to a child with fever or constipation.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Santonin
Is the active principle of Santonica, the unexpanded flower heads of *Artemisia Maritima*-Cina, which see.
The eye symptoms and those of the urinary tract are most prominent. It is of unquestioned value in the treatment of worm diseases, as gastro-intestinal irritation, *itching of nose*, restless sleep, twitching of muscles. Ascaris lumbricoides, and thread worms, but not tapeworms. *Night cough* of children. *Chronic cystitis*. Laryngeal crises and lightning pains of tabes.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Occipital headache, with *chromatic hallucinations*. *Itching of nose*. Bores into nostrils.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Sudden dimness of sight. *Color blindness*; Xanthopsia. Strabismus due to worms. Dark rings about eyes.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Fetid breath, depraved appetite; thirsty. Tongue deep-red. *Grinding of teeth*. Nausea; better after eating. Choking feeling.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Urine greenish if acid and reddish purple if alkaline. *Incontinence and dysuria. Enuresis*. Feeling of fullness of bladder. Nephritis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Cina; Teucr; Napth; Nat phos; Spigel*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Second to third trituration. Lower preparations are often toxic. Do not give to a child with fever or constipation.

saponaria.name: Saponaria
saponaria.essence: Of great use in the treatment of acute colds, coryza, sore throat, etc. Will often "break up" a cold.

agg: at night, mental exertion, left side

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Soap Root (SAPONARIA)
Of great use in the treatment of acute colds, coryza, sore throat, etc. Will often "break up" a cold.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Utter indifference to pain or possible death. Apathetic, *depressed, with sleepiness*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Stitching pain, *supraorbital*; worse, left side, evening, motion. Throbbing over orbits. Congestions to head; tired feeling in nape. *Coryza*. Sensation of drunkenness with constant endeavor to go left-wards. Left-sided trigeminal neuralgia, especially supraorbital. Stopped up feeling in nose, also itching and sneezing.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Violent eye pains. Hot stitches deep in eyeball. Ciliary neuralgia; worse, left side. Photophobia. Exophthalmos, worse reading and writing. Increased intraocular pressure. Glaucoma.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Difficult swallowing. Nausea, heartburn; full feeling not relieved by eructation.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Impulse weak; pulse less frequent. Palpitation with anxiety.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, at night, mental exertion, left side.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Compare: *Saponin*-a glucosidal principle found in Quillaya, Yucca, Senega, Dioscorea and other plants (Tired, indifferent. *Pain in left temple, eye*, photophobia, hot stitches deep in eye. Fifth nerve affections. Migraine. Much pain *before* the menstrual flow; severe sore throat, worse right side; tonsils swollen, worse in warm room. Sharp burning taste and violent sneezing).
Compare, also: *Verbasc; Coccul* (both containing Saponin). *Quillaya*; (Anagallis, *Agrostema*, Helonias, Sarsaparilla, Paris, Cyclamen and others contain Saponin).

sarothamnus-scoparius.name: Sarothamnus Scoparius
sarothamnus-scoparius.essence:
Spartein sulphate increase the strength of the heart, slows it and reduces the blood pressure. It continues the good effects of Veratrum and Digitalis without any of the undesirable effects of either (Hinsdale).

The effect of spartein sulphate (the alkaloid of Broom) is to cause a *lowering* of the systolic and diastolic pressures of the provers. Sphygmograms also show a condition of lowered blood-pressure. It depresses the heart by poisonous action exerted on the myocardium and this, with the ...
sarothamnus-scoparius.dosing:
For non-homeopathic use (palliative as above), one to two grains t.i.d by mouth, exerts a definite action upon the kidneys that will enable them to relieve the distress upon the heart. It is a safe drug and prompt in its action. Hypodermically, not less than 1/4 of a grain. Doses as high as 2 grains by mouth three times a day are safe (Hinsdale).
Homeopathically. First to third trituration.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Broom (SPARTIUM SCOPARIUM - CYSTISUS SCOPARIUS)
Spartein sulphate increase the strength of the heart, slows it and reduces the blood pressure. It continues the good effects of Veratrum and Digitalis without any of the undesirable effects of either (Hinsdale).
The effect of spartein sulphate (the alkaloid of Broom) is to cause a *lowering* of the systolic and diastolic pressures of the provers. Sphygmograms also show a condition of lowered blood-pressure. It depresses the heart by poisonous action exerted on the myocardium and this, with the stimulating action of the drug upon the vagus, accounts for the lowered blood pressure and reduced pulse rate. It weakens the cardiac contraction. The total amount of urine is increased. The drug has, therefore, diuretic properties and is useful in dropsy.
Albuminuria. Cheyne-Stokes respiration. Irregular heart following grip and various infections. Hypotension used palliatively in physiological dosage to combat arterial hypertension, arterio-sclerosis. Very useful hypodermically 1/10 to 1/4 grain in sustaining heart after stopping habit of Morphia. Spartium is indicated when primarily the muscles of the heart and especially the nervous apparatus is affected. Acts rapidly and lasts three to four days. Does not disturb digestion. Nephritis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tobacco heart. Angina pectoris. Irregular action, disturbed rhythm due to gas, etc, feeble in nervous hysterical patients. Myocardial degeneration, failing compensation. Hypotension. Spartein in 2 gr doses for water-logged cases, cannot lie down. Here it produces much comfort. Has specific action upon the kidneys, enabling them to eliminate and relieve the distress upon the heart.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Great accumulation of gas in gastro-intestinal canal, with mental depression.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Burning along urinary tract or in pudendum. *Profuse flow of urine*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
For non-homeopathic use (palliative as above), one to two grains t.i.d by mouth, exerts a definite action upon the kidneys that will enable them to relieve the distress upon the heart. It is a safe drug and prompt in its action. Hypodermically, not less than 1/4 of a grain. Doses as high as 2 grains by mouth three times a day are safe (Hinsdale).
Homeopathically. First to third trituration.

sarracenia-purpurea.name: Sarracenia Purpurea
sarracenia-purpurea.essence: A remedy for variola. Visual disorders. Congestion to head, with irregular heart action. Chlorosis. Contains a very active proteolytic enzyme. Sick headache; throbbing in various parts, especially in neck, shoulders and head, which feels full to bursting.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Hungry all the time, even after a meal. Sleepy during meals. Copious, painful vomiting.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pains shooting in *zig-zag* course from lumbar region to middle of scapula.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Limbs weak; bruised pain in knees and hip-joints. Bones in arm pain. *Weak between shoulders*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Variola, aborts the disease, arrests pustulation.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Tartar em; Variol; Maland*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Third to sixth potency.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Pitcher-plant
A remedy for variola. Visual disorders. Congestion to head, with irregular heart action. Chlorosis. Contains a very active proteolytic enzyme. Sick headache; throbbing in various parts, especially in neck, shoulders and head, which feels full to bursting.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Photophobia. Eyes feel swollen and sore. Pain in orbits. Black objects move with the eye.

sarsaparilla-officinalis.name: Sarsaparilla Officinalis
sarsaparilla-officinalis.essence: Renal colic; marasmus and periosteal pains due to venereal disease. Eruptions following hot weather and vaccinations; boils, and eczema. Urinary symptoms well marked.

agg: dampness at night, after urinating, when yawning, in spring, before menses

complementary: Berb; Lycop; Nat m; Petrol; Sassafras; Saururus

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Smilax (SARSAPARILLA)
Renal colic; marasmus and periosteal pains due to venereal disease. Eruptions following hot weather and vaccinations; boils, and eczema. Urinary symptoms well marked.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Despondent, sensitive, easily offended, ill humored and taciturn.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Pains cause depression*. Shooting pain from above right temporal region. Pains *from occiput to eyes*. Words reverberate in ear to the root of nose. Periosteal pains due to venereal disease. Influenza. Scalp sensitive. *Eruptions on face and upper lip*. Moist eruption on scalp. Crusta lactea beginning in face.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tongue white; *aphthae; salivation*; metallic taste; no thirst. Fetid breath.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Rumbling and fermentation. *Colic and backache at same time*. Much flatus; cholera infantum.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Urine scanty, slimy, flaky, sandy, *bloody*. Gravel. Renal colic. *Severe pain at conclusion of urination*. *Urine dribbles while sitting*. Bladder distended and tender. *Child screams before and while passing urine*. Sand on diaper. Renal colic and dysuria in infants. *Pain from right kidney downward*. Tenesmus of bladder; urine passes in thin, feeble stream. Pain at meatus.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Bloody, seminal emissions. Intolerable stench on genitals. Herpetic eruption on genitals. Itching on scrotum and perineum. Syphilis; squamous eruption and bone pains.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Nipples small, withered, *retracted*.
*Before menstruation, itching and humid eruption of forehead*. Menses late and scanty. Moist eruption in right groin before menses.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Emaciated, shriveled, lies in folds* (*Abrot; Sanic*), dry, flabby. Herpetic eruptions; ulcers. Rash from exposure to open air; dry, itching; *comes on in spring*; becomes crusty. Rhagades; skin cracked on hands and feet. Skin hard, indurated. Summer cutaneous affections.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Paralytic, tearing pains. Trembling of hands and feet. Burning on sides of fingers and toes. Onychia, ulceration around ends of fingers, cutting sensation under nails. Rheumatism, bone pains; worse at night. Deep rhagades on fingers and toes; burn under nails. Tetter on hands; ulceration around ends of fingers (*Psorin*). Cutting sensation under nails (*Petrol*). Rheumatic pains after gonorrhoea.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, dampness at night, after urinating, when yawning, in spring, before menses.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Complementary: *Merc; Sep*.
Compare: *Berb; Lycop; Nat m; Petrol; Sassafras; Saururus*-Lizard's tail--(Irritation of kidneys, bladder, prostate and urinary passages. Painful and difficult micturition; cystitis with strangury). *Cucurbita citrellus*-Water-melon. Infusion of the seed acts promptly in painful urination with constriction and backache, relieves pain and stimulates flow
Antidote: *Bell*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: First to sixth potency.

scrophularia-nodosa.name: Scrophularia Nodosa
scrophularia-nodosa.essence:
A powerful medicine whenever *enlarged glands* are present. Hodgkin's disease.

A valuable skin remedy. Has a specific affinity for the breast; very useful in the dissipation of breast tumors. *Eczema of the ear*. Pruritus vaginae. Lupoid ulceration. *Scrofulous swellings* (*Cistus*). *Painful haemorrhoids*. Tubercular testis. Epithelioma. Nodosities in the breasts (*Scirrhinum*). Pain in all flexor muscles.
scrophularia-nodosa.dosing: Tincture and first potency. Apply locally to cancerous glands also Semper viv.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Knotted Figwort
A powerful medicine whenever *enlarged glands* are present. Hodgkin's disease.
A valuable skin remedy. Has a specific affinity for the breast; very useful in the dissipation of breast tumors. *Eczema of the ear*. Pruritus vaginae. Lupoid ulceration. *Scrofulous swellings* (*Cistus*). *Painful haemorrhoids*. Tubercular testis. Epithelioma. Nodosities in the breasts (*Scirrhinum*). Pain in all flexor muscles.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Vertigo felt in vertex, greater when standing; drowsiness; pain from forehead to back of head. Eczema behind ear. Crusta lactea.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Distressing photophobia (*Conium*). Spots before eyes. Stitches in eyebrow. Sore eyeballs.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Inflammation about auricle. Deep ulcerated auricle. Eczema around ear.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Pain in liver* on pressure. Colic below navel. Pain in sigmoid flexure and rectum. *Painful*, bleeding, protruding *piles*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Violent dyspnoea, oppression of chest with trembling. Pain about bifurcation of trachea. Asthma in scrofulous patients.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Prickling itching, worse back of hand.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Great drowsiness*; in morning and before and after meals with weariness.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
*Worse* lying on right side.
Compare: *Lobel erinus; Ruta; Carcinosin; Conium; Asterias*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tincture and first potency. Apply locally to cancerous glands also Semper viv.

scutellaria-lateriflora.name: Scutellaria Lateriflora
scutellaria-lateriflora.essence: This is a nervous sedative, where *nervous fear* predominates. *Cardiac irritability. Chorea*. Nervous irritation and spasms of children, during dentition. *Twitching of muscles*. Nervous weakness after influenza.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Skullcap
This is a nervous sedative, where *nervous fear* predominates. *Cardiac irritability. Chorea*. Nervous irritation and spasms of children, during dentition. *Twitching of muscles*. Nervous weakness after influenza.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Fear of some calamity*. Inability to fix attention (*Aethus*). Confusion.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Dull, frontal headache*. Eyes feel pressed outwards. Flushed face. Restless sleep and frightful dreams. *Must move about*. Night terrors. Migraine; worse, over right eye; *aching in eyeballs*. Explosive headaches of school teachers with frequent urination; headaches in front and base of brain. Nervous sick headaches, worse noise, odor light, better night; rest, 5 drops of tincture.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Nausea; sour eructations; hiccough; pain and distress.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Gas, fullness and distention, colicky pain and uneasiness. Light colored diarrhoea.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Seminal emissions and impotency, with fear of never being better.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Night-terrors; sleeplessness; sudden wakefulness; frightful dreams.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Twitchings of muscles; must be moving. Chorea. Tremors. Sharp stinging pains in upper extremities. Nightly restlessness. Weakness and aching.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Compare: *Cyprip; Lycopus*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tincture and lower potencies.

secale-cornutum.name: Secale Cornutum
secale-cornutum.essence: Produces contraction of the unstriped muscular fibers; hence a constringent feeling throughout the whole body. This produces an anaemic condition, coldness, numbness, petechiae, mortification, gangrene. A useful remedy for old people with shriveled skin-thin, scrawny old women. All the Secale conditions are *better from cold*; the whole body is pervaded by a sense of great heat. Haemorrhages; continued oozing; *thin*, fetid, watery black blood. *Debility, anxiety, emaciation, though appetite and...
secale-cornutum.dosing: First to thirtieth potency. *Non-homeopathic use*. In haemorrhages of the puerperium, after the uterus in entirely emptied, when it fails to contract satisfactorily and in secondary puerperal haemorrhage the result of incomplete involution of the uterus, give one-half to one dram of the fluid extract. Remember Pagot's law. "As long as the uterus contains, anything, be it child, placenta, membranes, clots, never administer Ergot".

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Pupils dilated. Incipient cataract, senile especially in women. *Eyes sunken and surrounded by a blue margin*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Pale, pinched, sunken*. Cramps commence in face and spread over whole body. Livid spots on face. *Spasmodic distortion*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Tongue dry, *cracked; blood like ink exudes*, coated thick; viscid, yellowish, cold livid. *Tingling of tip of tongue, which is stiff*. Tongue swollen, paralyzed.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Unnatural ravenous appetite; craves* acids. *Thirst* unquenchable. Singultus, nausea; vomiting of blood and coffee-grounds fluid. Burning in stomach and abdomen; tympanites. Eructations of bad odor.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Ergot (CLAVICEPS PURPUREA)
Produces contraction of the unstriped muscular fibers; hence a constringent feeling throughout the whole body. This produces an anaemic condition, coldness, numbness, petechiae, mortification, gangrene. A useful remedy for old people with shriveled skin-thin, scrawny old women. All the Secale conditions are *better from cold*; the whole body is pervaded by a sense of great heat. Haemorrhages; continued oozing; *thin*, fetid, watery black blood. *Debility, anxiety, emaciation, though appetite and thirst may be excessive*. Facial and abdominal muscles twitch. Secale decreases the flow of pancreatic juice by raising the blood pressure (Hinsdale).

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Passive, congestive pain (rises from back of head), with pale face. Head drawn back. Falling of hair; dry and gray. *Nosebleed*, dark, oozing.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Cholera-like stools, with coldness and cramps. *Olivegreen, thin, putrid, bloody, with icy coldness and intolerance of being covered, with great exhaustion. Involuntary stools*; no sensation of passing feces, anus wide open.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Paralysis of bladder. Retention, with unsuccessful urging. Discharge of black blood from bladder. Enuresis in old people.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Menstrual colic, with coldness and intolerance of heat. Passive haemorrhages in feeble, cachectic women. Burning pains in uterus. *Brownish, offensive leucorrhoea*. Menses irregular, copious, dark; *continuous oozing of watery blood* until next period. Threatened abortion about the *third* month (*Sab*). During labor no expulsive action, though everything is relaxed. After-pains. Suppression of milk; breasts do not fill properly. Dark, offensive lochia. Puerperal fever, putrid discharges, tympanitis, coldness, suppressed urine.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Angina pectoris. Dyspnoea and oppression, with cramp in diaphragm. Boring pain in chest. Praecordial tenderness. Palpitation, with contracted and intermittent pulse.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Profound and long. Insomnia with restlessness, fever, anxious dreams. *Insomnia of drug and liquor habitudes*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Spinal irritation, tingling of lower extremities; can bear only slightest covering. *Locomotor ataxia*. Formication and numbness. Myelitis.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Cold, dry hands and feet of excessive smokers with feeling of fuzziness in fingers. Trembling, staggering gait. Formication, pain and spasmodic movements. Numbness. Fingers and feet bluish, shriveled, *spread apart or bent backwards*, numb. *Violent cramps. Icy coldness of extremities*. Violent pain in finger-tips, tingling in toes.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: Shriveled, numb; mottled dusky-blue tinge. Scleraema and oedema neonatorum. Raynaud's disease. Blue color. *Dry gangrene*, developing slowly. *Varicose ulcers. Burning sensation*; better by cold; *wants parts uncovered*, though cold to touch. Formication; petechiae. Slight wounds continue to bleed. Livid spots. Boils, small, painful, with green contents; mature slowly. *Skin feels cold to touch*, yet covering is not tolerated. *Great aversion to heat. Formication under skin*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Coldness*; cold, dry skin; cold, clammy sweat; excessive thirst. Sense of internal heat.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: *Worse*, heat, *warm covering*. *Better*, cold, *uncovering*, rubbing, stretching out limbs.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text: First to thirtieth potency. *Non-homeopathic use*. In haemorrhages of the puerperium, after the uterus in entirely emptied, when it fails to contract satisfactorily and in secondary puerperal haemorrhage the result of incomplete involution of the uterus, give one-half to one dram of the fluid extract. Remember Pagot's law. "As long as the uterus contains, anything, be it child, placenta, membranes, clots, never administer Ergot".

sedum-acre.name: Sedum Acre
sedum-acre.essence: Haemorrhoidal pains, like those of anal fissures; constricting pains, worse few hours after stool. *Fissures*.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Small Houseleek
Haemorrhoidal pains, like those of anal fissures; constricting pains, worse few hours after stool. *Fissures*.

serum-anguillae.name: Serum Anguillae
serum-anguillae.essence:
The serum *of the eel* has a toxic action on the blood, rapidly destroying its globules. The presence of albumin and renal elements in the urine, the hemoglobinuria, the prolonged anuria (24 and 26 hours), together with the results of the autopsy, plainly demonstrate its elective action on the kidneys. Secondarily, the liver and the heart are affected, and the alterations observed are those usually present in infectious diseases.

From all these facts it is easy to infer, *a priori*, the therape...
serum-anguillae.dosing: Attenuations are made with glycerine or distilled water, the lower 1x to 3 in heart disease, the higher in sudden renal attacks.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Eel Serum (SERUM ANGUILLAR ICHTHYOTOXIN)
The serum *of the eel* has a toxic action on the blood, rapidly destroying its globules. The presence of albumin and renal elements in the urine, the hemoglobinuria, the prolonged anuria (24 and 26 hours), together with the results of the autopsy, plainly demonstrate its elective action on the kidneys. Secondarily, the liver and the heart are affected, and the alterations observed are those usually present in infectious diseases.
From all these facts it is easy to infer, *a priori*, the therapeutical indications of the *serum of the eel*. Whenever the kidney becomes acutely affected, either from cold or infection or intoxication, and the attack is characterized by *oliguria, anuria* and *albuminuria*, we will find the *eel's serum* eminently efficacious to re-establish diuresis, and in rapidly arresting albuminuria. When during the course of *heart-disease*, the kidney, previously working well, should suddenly become affected and its function inhibited; and when besides we observe cardiac irregularities and a marked state of asystolia, we may yet expect good results from this serum. But to determine here the choice of this remedy is not an easy matter. While *digitalis* presents in its indications, the well-known symptomatic trilogy: *arterial hypertension oliguria and oedema; the serum of the eel* seems better adapted to cases of *hypertension and oliguria, without oedema*. We should bear in mind that the elective action of the eel's serum is on the kidney, and I believe we can well assert that if *digitalis* is a cardiac, the *eel's serum* is a renal remedy. So far, at least, the clinical observations published seem to confirm this distinction. The serum of the eel has given very small results in attacks of asystolia; but it has been very efficacious in *cardiac uraemia*. There, where *digitalis* is powerless, the *serum of the eel* has put an end to the renal obstruction and produced an abundant diuresis. But its really specific indication seems to be for *acute nephritis a frigori* (Jousset)
Subacute nephritis. Heart diseases, in cases of failure of compensation and impending asytole. The experiments of Dr. Jousset have amply demonstrated the rapid haematuria, albuminuria and oliguria caused by it. In the presence of acute nephritis with threatening uraemia we should always think of this serum. Very efficacious in functional heart diseases. Mitral insufficiency, asystolia with or without oedema, dyspnoea and difficult urinary secretion.

materiaMedica.source: Pocket manual of homoeopathic materia medica
materiaMedica.text:
Great analogy exists between eel serum and the venom of the *Vipera*.
Compare also: *Pelias; Lachesis*.
